loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. 

This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is from Eastern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a persevering and responsible mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for them. 

She is earning a living in her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. To generate more income, Charlita decided to expand her inventory after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. 

Consequently, she requested a loan to restock more inventory for her store to increase sales. 

Charlita smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life, and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to restock inventories

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 45 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Anabel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, etc. 

Anabel has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future Anabel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like bread, chips, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 64 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soap, breads, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soap, breads, coffee, sugar, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 40 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, school supplies and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 17 years now. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, school supplies and other groceries

loans.name: Marecel

texts.en:
Marecel is 31 years old and single with two children.  With two children are still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marecel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

She has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Gladys operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.  Gladys dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. 

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materia prima para elaborar la comida que ofrece en su comedor, lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia, ya que de esta manera obtiene los ingresos para cancelar sus deudas, mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y brinda oportunidades a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando.
Nuevamente hace una solicitud de crédito, que le será de ayuda para comprar carnes, pollo, verduras, bebidas, etc., para elaborar la comida y el resto lo invertirá en electrodomésticos para realizar sus actividades diarias, espera seguir progresando, Rosa tiene nuevos clientes por lo que ya está elaborando meriendas típicas por las tardes.
texts.en:
Rosa used the previous loan to buy ingredients to prepare the food she offers at her restaurant. This was very beneficial for her and her family, since this is how she earns money to pay her loans, improves her family’s living conditions, and offers her children the opportunity to stay in school.

She is requesting a loan again to buy different types of meat, chicken, vegetables, beverages, etc., to prepare food. She will use what is left to buy some appliances she needs for her daily activities. She hopes to continue improving. Rosa has new customers, so she is now preparing traditional food every afternoon.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, vegetables, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.en:
Guzman had the skills and expertise to be a potter, yet he didn't have enough capital to start a pottery business. As a responsible father from Lopez Jaena, he never gets tired of supporting his family. 

He joined PMPC, and after he learned he can gain financial assistance, Guzman decided to start a pottery business. It has been doing well as he has worked to perfect the shape and quality of his pots. Guzman has maximized his profits and keeps pursuing his goals for the good of his family. 

He is a new member of PMPC, and has requested a loan to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for his business. 

He hopes and prays that his business will grow and continue to benefit his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Carlo Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sui hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol también trabaja como jornal, desde hace 5 años trabaja en el cultivo, la cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños en la época de enero a junio, ya tiene clientes establecidos, y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea sembrar que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder tener una mejor cosecha y mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31, owns a house where he lives with his life partner and his son. Carlos works growing corn and beans, and sometimes as a day laborer. He has been in business for five years, and sells his produce in surrounding villages, from January to June. He has loyal customers. With the sales he makes, he manages to cover some home expenses.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides. He will also prepare the land he plans to sow, shown in the picture. This will result in a better harvest and more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides, and prepare the land for sowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Jackline owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Jackline has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to sell such as tubs and buckets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 29 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. В 2006 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 лошадь, 35 овец. Также на собственном земельном участке мерою 1,85 Га и арендованном - 1,0 Га Чынара выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят ей и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Chynara is 29 years old, married and the mother of four. In 2006 she launched a livestock business. At present she has one horse and 35 sheep on her farm. Also, Chynara grows potatoes and beans on her own land plot of 1.85 ha [4.5 cares] and a leased plot of 1.0 ha [2.5 acres]. Her total monthly income is approximately 10,000 KGS. Chynara has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy ten sheep. The revenues from this loan will allow her to keep developing her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda, who is a 63-year-old single woman, lives in Senaki district. She lives alone and the significant source of income to this woman is an age-pension, which she gets from the local government. She also has a small agricultural activity and sells products seasonally.

Izolda requires financial support for starting a more stable activity to meet even the basic needs. She lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. She requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business.

Izolda's loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products.

With the received credit, Izolda will purchase stock of clothing and will start a trading business. Her costumers will be mostly neighbors and she will get private orders as well. She is very thankful for the help, as she will be able to tackle financial difficulties and increase her income.

loans.use: to trade clothing and get business income.

loans.name: Violette

texts.fr:
Violette est une femme de 56 ans, elle est mariée et a eu 3 enfants, aujourd’hui adultes. Elle exerce une activité de vente de confection. Cela fait 30 ans qu’elle est dans ce secteur d’activité, elle a donc aujourd’hui une solide connaissance du marché et a choisi de devenir vendeuse ambulante.  Elle se déplace désormais dans d’autres régions pour proposer ses produits et ainsi élargir sa clientèle. 

Cela fait 11 ans qu’elle est partenaire chez Vahatra. Elle a commencé en vendant quelques vêtements puis, grâce aux prêts successifs qu’elle a obtenu, a pu progressivement augmenté et diversifié sa marchandise (sacs, chapeaux). Elle compte aujourd’hui utiliser son prêt pour acheter de nouveaux produits comme des chapeaux, des vêtements, des couvertures et des matelas.

Son objectif actuel  reste d’assurer le quotidien de sa famille en augmentant son capital. Cela lui permettra également de venir en aide à ses enfants en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
Violette is a 56 year old woman who is married and has 3 children, who are now adults. She has a clothing selling business. For the past 30 years, she has worked in this sector, and now has a solid understanding of the market and has chosen to become an itinerant seller. She travels to different regions in order to sell her products and grow her clientele.

She has been working with Vahatra for 11 years. She started by selling clothing, then, thanks to the successive loans she obtained, was able to augment and diversify her merchandise (bags, hats). She now plans to use her loan to purchase new products such as hats, clothing, blankets and mats. 

Her current objective is still to take care of her family's daily needs by growing her business. This will also allow her to help her children if needed.

loans.use: to buy hats and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rinah

texts.fr:
RINAH à le sens du commerce. C'est une jeune femme de 23 ans, tout juste marié qui a décidé d'avoir sa propre activité. Elle est originaire d'Antsirabe et habite dans une maison en dure en location.

Elle exerce une activité de vente d'accessoires téléphoniques devant son domicile. Elle est partenaire depuis maintenant plus de 3 ans chez Vahatra et a pu bénéficier de plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. 

Avec ce prêt, RINAH souhaite ouvrir un 2ème point de vente en centre ville afin d'élargir sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Elle souhaite ainsi acheter un stock d'accessoires téléphone, comme des batteries, des chargeurs, des housses.
texts.en:
Rinah is a natural businesswoman. She is a young woman, 23 years old, who just got married and decided to start her own business. She is originally from Antisrabe and lives in a rented brick-and-mortar house.

She keeps had her mobile phone accessory business in front of her house. She has been working with Vahatra for more than 3 years now and has benefited from several loans of larger and larger size.

With this loan, Rinah would like to open a second point of sale in the center of town in order to grow her client base and increase her revenues. She would also like to purchase a stock of phone accessories, such as batteries, chargers and cases.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone batteries, chargers and cases

loans.name: Ahsan

texts.en:
Ahsan runs a shop selling spare parts for bikes. He is 35 and married. He has good experience in this business given his success. He feels it’s the right time to expand and to invest in another business for spare bike parts. As many people in Karachi use bikes for affordable transportation, demand for spare parts is high so the prospects for income generation is favorable. Bike tire tubes and oil are in high demand at his shop. 
Ahsan does not want to miss this window of opportunity. Given that his savings are falling short, he has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan after agreeing to the terms and conditions for the loan. He is happy with the financing arrangement and plans to pay off the loan with the sales that will generate from the new business. 
He is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bike spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Raza

texts.fr:
Raza est une femme courageuse de 62 ans. Elle est aujourd’hui séparée et a élevé seule ses 4 enfants. Cela fait maintenant 14 ans qu’elle travaille dans le secteur du commerce, elle est actuellement vendeuse de légumes.

Raza est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 8 ans. Son premier prêt lui a alors servi à se lancer dans sa propre activité et elle a commencé à vendre à son compte quelques légumes devant son domicile, puis sur le marché de son quartier.  Elle est, par la suite, devenue vendeuse ambulante et se déplace aujourd’hui, maintenant que ses enfants sont grands et indépendants,  jusque sur la côté ouest de Madagascar pour vendre ses produits qui ne poussent pas dans cette région. 

Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour augmenter son capital et acheter des tomates, carottes, oignons et haricots en plus grande quantité. Elle espère ainsi pouvoir finaliser la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
Raza is a brave, 62-year-old woman. She is currently separated from her spouse and raised her 4 children alone. For the past 14 years she has worked in the commercial sector. Currently, she sells vegetables.

Raza has been working with Vahatra for the past 8 years. With her first loan, she launched her own business and began selling a few vegetables in front of her business, then at the market in her neighborhood. She subsequently became an itinerant seller, now that her children are grown and independent. Now she travels to the West coast of Madagascar to sell her products, which don't grow in that region.

She would like to use this new loan to augment her working capital to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions and beans in larger quantities. She would like to be able to finish construction on her home.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onoins and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hens and feed

loans.name: Reneria

texts.en:
Reneria operates a tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar attached). She earns income from fees she charges. She is a 52-year-old married mother of three children. One of her children is still attending school. She has been operating a tricycle transport service for more than 10 years.
  
She has requested a loan to buy motorcycle parts and pay for maintenance.  These parts and maintenance will be very helpful in providing quality services to her passengers and keeping them safe and comfortable during long-distance trips. Her income will improve and she will be able to settle her obligation. Then she can afford the schooling of her youngest child to the college level. Reneria dreams of purchasing another tricycle to expand her business to make it successful.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара 30 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Самары среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года она занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Самары есть 4 лошади, 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 40 овец. На арендованном земельном наделе мерою 2,0 Га и собственном- 0,37 Га, она выращивает фасоль.  Благодаря упорному труду Самары, ее деятельность приносит около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Самара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита позволят Самаре развить ее бизнес.
texts.en: Samara is 30, married, and a mother of four. She has a secondary education. She has earned the main income for her family through farming since 2008, when she started her own business with 10,000 som (KGS). She currently has four horses, two cows, two calves, and 40 sheep. She rents a 2.0 hectare plot of land and has her own 0.37 hectare plot for planting beans. Thanks to Samara's hard work, her farming activities earn her around 11,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Samara applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy three bull calves and fertilizers to treat the soil. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy three bull calves and fertilizers to treat the soil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Richante

texts.fr:
Richante est une jeune femme dynamique. Elle à 29 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants dans un quartier rural situé en périphérie de la commune d'Antsirabe. Elle n'est pas originaire de cette commune. Elle vient d'une région situé dans le grand sud de Madagascar et à décider de venir sur les hauts plateaux car son mari est originaire de cet endroit. 

Elle a commencé il y a 2 ans en partenariat avec Vahatra une activité d'élevage porcin. Elle a pu bénéficier de plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant ce qui lui a permis de construire une porcherie et d'acquérir plusieurs porcelets.

Elle souhaiterait aujourd'hui diversifier son activité et se lancer dans une activité de confection de robes. Pour cela elle a déjà une machine a coudre, mais a besoin d'acheter un stock de tissu et du matériel de coutures. Elle souhaite ensuite vendre cette production à des grossistes.
texts.en:
Richante is a young, dynamic woman. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children in a rural area on the outskirts of Antisrabe. She isn't originally from this area. She comes from a region in the very south of Madagascar and decided to come to the high plateau region because her husband is originally from this area.

She began to work with Vahatra 2 years ago, with a pig-raising business. She was able to take out several successive loans of increasing size, and this allowed her to construct a pig sty, and to purchase several piglets.

Today she would like to diversify her business and start a dressmaking business. She already has a sewing machine, but needs to stock up on fabric and sewing supplies. She would like to sell her products to wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons

loans.name: Joueline

texts.fr:
JOUELINE est une commerçante énergique. Elle est âgée de 36 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans la ville d'Antsirabe. Elle est originaire de cette commune ou ses parents exercés déjà des petites activité de commerce et de services. Elle vit dans une petite maison en dure dont elle est locataire.

Depuis maintenant 6 ans, elle est partenaire de Vahatra. Elle a pu bénéficier de plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant supérieur ce qui lui a permis de développer un commerce de vente de produits et d'accessoires électroniques tel que des radios, des calculettes, des montres.

Avec ce prêt, JOUELINE souhaite augmenter le capital de son activité afin d'avoir un stock suffisant pour pouvoir acheter les produits au bon moment. A long terme,  son objectif c'est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Joueline is an energetic saleswoman. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 children in Antisrabe. She is originally from this area, where her parents already had small trading and service businesses. She lives in a small brick-and-mortar house that she rents.

For the past 6 years, she has been working with Vahatra. She was able to take out successive loans of larger and larger size, which allowed her to develop a business where she sells electronic products and accessories such as radios, calculators and watches.

With this loan, Joeline would like to increase her working capital in order to purchase a large stock and be able to purchase her products at an advantageous time. In the long term, her objective is to construct her own home.

loans.use: to buy radios, lamps, calculators and watches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stable goods and sacks of rice

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in Plaridel, Philippines. Josephine is a businesswoman, selling fashion jewelries and accessories. 

Josephine requested a loan from PMPC for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bags of cement and floor tiles for house completion. She hopes to provide her family with a decent and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and floor tiles for house completion

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Béatrice est une femme active de 29 ans séparée du père de ses 2 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle vit  avec sa mère et sa sœur au sein du même foyer dans une petite bourgade près d’Antsirabe. Cette famille composée de femmes doit se battre au quotidien pour améliorer sa situation et assurer l’avenir de ses enfants sans homme à la maison.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Elle tient une petite épicerie qui propose des produits de première nécessité dans un quartier commerçant. Parallèlement à cela, elle fait également une activité d’élevage de porcs. 

Ce prêt lui permettrait de diversifier les produits qu’elle propose dans sa boutique, elle compte donc acheter du riz, de l’huile et du sucre. Grâce au prêt, elle pourra également acheter de nouveaux cochons qui lui permettront ainsi d’agrandir son élevage.
texts.en:
Béatrice is an active 29 year old woman who separated from the father of her 2 children. The children are in her care. She lives with her mother and her sister in the same household in a little village near Antisrabe. This family of women must struggle each day in order to improve their situation and provide for the future of their children, with no men in the house.

She has been working with Vahatra for the past 3 years. She has a small grocery store where she sells staple goods in a commercial neighborhood. Alongside this business, she also raises pigs.

This loan will allow her to diversify the products she offers in her store, and would like to purchase rice, oil and sugar. Thanks to the loan, she can also purchase new piglets, which will allow her to grow her livestock raising business.

loans.use: to buy food products and other household products

loans.name: Baktybu

texts.ru: Бактыбу 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Бактыбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Бактыбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Baktybu is 38, married, and has three children. She also runs her farm. Baktybu has a secondary education and raises livestock for her family's main source of income. She started the business twenty years ago when she bought livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows and a horse and earns 7,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business in the future, Baktybu applied for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a dairy cow and increase her sales of organic milk. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to sell more organic milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, iron, and pay for labor required for the construction of a wall.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a businesswoman who has had been widowed for 18 years. She lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel. She became a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and runs a retail store selling thatched 'nipa' for constructing house walls. Running this type of business has supported her family's needs. 

Recently, Lorna applied for a loan to purchase more inventories of nipa, to be weaved for her business of selling thatched nipa. Lorna believes that having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. 

She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of 'nipa,' to be weaved for her business of selling thatched nipa.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 43 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Nenita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Nenita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Denicita

texts.en: Retailing helps Denicita sustain her family. She retails charcoal and brings a meager income of Php 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Denicita plans to expand her retailing business. She has applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Denicita smiles at the dream to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking mother from Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Editha has signed her membership with the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Editha hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a widower from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, industriously caring for his fishing activities. He has become an active member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

Currently, Pedro sees a good opportunity to expand his business. He is requesting PHP 7,000 from PMPC for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. He deeply wishes to continuously provide for his needs and be able to support his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita manages her eatery business in Sindangan. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This endeavor has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering jobs for added income. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Meralona

texts.en:
Meralona is married and has three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She has been in this business now for about 15 years and is well-known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 4,000 per month. 

Meralona is seeking a PHP 13,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Meralona is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy new items for foot spa services

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza, a hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old with two children. With one child in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store like eggs, condiments and other groceries.

Lucia has been in this business for 21 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store like eggs, condiments and other groceries

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane works at local beauty salon in Kapan, Syunik region. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. She started her hairdresser career three years ago. Since Gayane had not had a stable job for some time, she decided to start working as a hairdresser and cosmetologist. 

By applying for this loan Gayane would like to purchase furniture for cosmetological service and tools and materials for hairdressing service. This will help her to enlarge her own business, have a steady income, and become more independent.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for furniture for cosmetological service and tools and materials for hairdressing service

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda mejorando el pozo que muestra en la fotografía ya que de ahí es de donde obtiene el agua para los quehaceres del hogar, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, lasos, cemento, arena y pago de obra para poder mejorar el pozo y tener siempre el agua que necesita.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old. She lives with her husband in a house that they own. She has had a shop located in her place of residence for seven years; with what she earns from her sales, she manages to support herself. 

Maria wants to improve her house by making improvements to the well that appears in the photograph; it's from that well that she obtains water for her household chores. With what she earns from her sales, she can't afford to do it, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood, nails, rope, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor. Then she will be able to improve the well and always have the water that she needs.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, rope, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married, and she lives with her husband and five children in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. For the past thirty years, Rosalia and her husband have been farmers. She earns 15,000 PHP each crop focusing on rice farming. 

Rosalia became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Mil John

texts.en:
Mil John is 22 years old and single. He is living with his parents and three siblings in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is earning a profit working as a salesman in a retail store. Mil John also engaged in a hog raising business to generate additional income. This is how he helps his parents in sustaining their family needs. 

Mil John joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to learn about insurance and financial assistance. He is a responsible son who has a strong determination to pursue his goals. Someday, he hopes to have a stable financial status to continuously support his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of hog-growing pellets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like home care products and groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like home care products and groceries

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells basic commodities ranging from canned goods, biscuits, noodles, beverages, soft drinks and toiletries. She is 39 years old, and a married woman with two children ages 19 and 17 year old respectively. Her husband earns a living by being an electrician. She has been operating a store for 10 years now. In addition to that, she also engages in dressmaking, to have an additional income.

She has requested a loan to buy groceries for the store and materials for dressmaking like cloth and thread.  These will help her sell more merchandise and be able to continue her dressmaking livelihood. In this way, she will improve her income and continue to send her children to school. Concepcion hopes that she will be able to handle her both sources of income successfully for brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store and materials for dressmaking like cloth and thread.

loans.name: Al

texts.en: Al is 35 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad. He is the breadwinner for the family. He has experienced hardships, especially in raising his family. This industrious member finds himself plowing the camote (sweet potato) crops and planting vegetables. In need of additional working capital, Al joined Paglaum Cooperative. He has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 14,000 PHP, which he will use to buy for vegetable seedlings and two sacks of fertilizers. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, he has been able to manage his income and provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings and two sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy has mastered working on swine production in Oroquieta. This is how she makes a living in addition to her husband's income and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. She became an active member in PMPC and wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 7,000 will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for the swine and animal vitamins for her piglets. In the future, Mercy hopes to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for the swine and animal vitamins for her piglets

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Tuvyumvakumwe Group

texts.fr:
Philippe  fait partie du groupe  Tuvyumvakumwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 49 ans et est marié à Euphraise, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 21 à 24 ans.
Il a sous sa charge 4 enfants membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  bière  dans son bistrot  depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu'il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses  de bière, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Philippe is a member of  Tuvyumvakumwe and lives in Bujumbura. He is 49 years old and married to Euphrasie, a stonemason. They have two children, 21 and 24 years of age. Philippe has in his care four children who belong to his extended family; all four are in school.

He has been selling beer in his café for three years.
He is on his third loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and stock up on cases of beer for resale in order to increase his earnings. In the years to come he would like to buy a land plot.

loans.use: to stock up on beer for resale.

loans.name: Devora

texts.en:
Devora is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Devora is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eliseta

texts.en:
Eliseta is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eliseta is 50 years old and has one child in school. She has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines. 

Eliseta has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to puchase bundles of used shoes to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eliseta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to puchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 28, is a charismatic, hardworking woman who always has enjoyed working independently, managing her time and being on her mixed farm. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Thika area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Naomi's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

For a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Duhoze Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure  fait partie du groupe  Duhoze et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 47 ans et est marié à Marie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7enfants âgés de 3 à 22 ans, dont  7 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge sa mère. 

IL fait le commerce de  vaches  depuis  3 ans. 

Il est son à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit kiva qu'il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter deux vaches et chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des terres pour l’agriculture, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is part of the group Duhoze and lives in Bujumbura. He is 47 years old and married to Marie, a farmer. Together they have seven children, from 3 to 22  years old, of whom seven are students. He has his mother to support.

Bonaventure has been doing commerce in cows for three years. 

He is on his 2nd loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase two cows and goats to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy some land for farming and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and goats to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Savcpung's Group

texts.en: Savcpung’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Savcpung makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 6 años, comercializa sus productos en los meses de diciembre a febrero y los vende en las agencias de granos básico que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, pesticidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. For the past six years, he has been working growing corn, beans, and sorghum. He sells his products in the months of December through Februaryto the basic grain distributors located nearby. What he makes from his sales allows him to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pest control products, pesticides, etc. in order to continue growing his crops and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control products, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 40 years old and she is married with three children. She has had a business of rental houses for six years from which she has earned a monthly income of KES 40,000.

Ann has requested her 6th loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 80,000 that she will be using to purchase materials for construction as well as to pay wages for the workers. With the profits, Ann will be able to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are see that her children are educated for life and that her rentals are continually occupied and preferred by her clients.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction and to pay wages for the workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elvira is 51 years old now.

Elvira has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 45 years old, married and has eight children, five of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines which she has been doing for 22 years. 

Estrella requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase abaca fiber for her business. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase abaca fiber for her business

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Peris, a farmer from Mosobeti, a remote village in Nyamira, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking among most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Peris practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training seminars she has been attending to broaden her skills. Her primary source of income is milk, poultry and also she also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge: the high prices being charged for fertilizers, seedlings and inputs by the only agro-vet shop in her area. The Mosobeti area has only one agro dealer catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly. Peris wants to change this. She is requesting a loan to start an agro-vet shop. Through your loan, Peris will be able to help the smallholder farmers in her area who for a long time have had a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs.

Through your loan, Peris will be able to seize this business opportunity and tap into the potential agricultural market. She will transition from the peasant farmer she is right now to being a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 2,000 smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs. Through increased income from the loan, Peris will improve her living conditions. Peris believes that there is no doubt that people like her can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To start an agro-vet shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and metal beams, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 13 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gasto del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía  para poder ampliar mas la casa y así poder tener un lugar donde ubicar su negocio, pro con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita a integral un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y así poder vivir más seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Silvia is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has worked making clothing for 13 years and with what she makes from her work she helps her husband mange to get ahead with the household expenses. She wants to make improvements on her house by constructing a room as shown in the photograph to expand the house more and be able to have a place for her business. As what she makes is not enough to do this she is requesting a loan from Integral to buy cement, sand, bricks, re-bar and to pay for labor. Then she can live more securely with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, re bar and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La socia Petronila se dedica al negocio de imprenta como hacer tarjetas y diplomas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de imprenta. La socia solicita el credito para comprar papeles, tintas y cartulinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Petronila works in the printing business, making cards and diplomas. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and has been in this business for several years. Things are going very well for her. 

This member's goal is to expand her printing business. She is requesting this loan to buy paper, ink, and card paper. She is happy with this loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, and card paper.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 53 years old now.

She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Flor requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Having been in this business for four years, Flor would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio, está mejorando el negocio con las ganancias obtenidas de la inversión del préstamo anterior, tuvo los recursos económicos para recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, comenta que está iniciando a comercializar piedra, ganado y cerdos.
Requiere de un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer su negocio, comprara cerdos, ganado y alimento para los mismos, de esa manera los cuidara y venderá a un mejor precio, espera continuar trabajando para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fidencio is improving his business with the profit he made from investing his previous loan. He had enough financial resources to harvest his crops of basic grains and fulfill his customers' orders. He says he is now starting to sell stone, cattle, and pigs.

He needs a new loan in order to strengthen his business. He will use it to buy pigs, cattle, and feed for these animals. This will allow him to care for them and sell them at a better price. He hopes to keep working so that he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, cattle, and animal feed.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past three years, selling to the neighbors. She mentioned that seasonality has been the major challenge facing her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds for resale

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Patrick, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 36 years old, married and has four children. Patrick has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Patrick isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Patrick will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone.

Using this loan, Patrick's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 25 years old and single. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working as a bus driver for six years, transporting students to/from school to cover his needs and expenses.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to do necessary maintenance on his bus. He hopes to improve and develop his business through buying a bigger bus for a better future.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia Livia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la ropa lo vende en forma independiente y productos de primera necesidad cocmo arroz,azucar y leche,la socia por medio de sus dos pequeños negocios saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ,casacas,pantalones,blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Livia is still in business selling clothing. She sells her clothing items on her own and also sells basic grocery items like rice, sugar, and milk. These two small businesses allow this member to provide for her family. Her goal is to one day have a commercial space where she could set up a store to sell her clothing.

She is requesting this loan to buy jackets, pants, blouses, and sweaters. She is happy with this loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy jackets, pants, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 24 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, sugar, eggs, and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, sugar, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en:
Cleofas is 59 years old, and she is married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cleofas is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cleofas has been in this business for a year.  She also earns income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Kapan, in the Syunik region of Armenia.  He works in construction, with some years of experience in that field. 
He is a father of two. His children attend the local secondary school.  His wife is unemployed. 

Ashot started providing construction services in Kapan five years ago. He receives orders for the internal or external renovation of houses from local people in town and in nearby villages. All he needs is the financial resources to buy the tools and materials for his work. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for the tools and materials that he needs in the construction trade.

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en:
Tsisana is a 59-year-old unemployed woman from a village named Kvilishori. She lives with her husband, daughter and son-in-law, who works as a private artisan. Tsisana's daughter is also employed and earns a fixed salary.

In order to contribute her bit to the family's welfare, Tsisana decided to start her own activity. All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Tsisana applied to MFO Credo for credit. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

With the requested amount, Tsisana will purchase all of the tools and equipment that she needs and will open a sewing workshop in her house. She will get private orders and sew various kinds of clothing, curtains, and other items clients need for their homes.
 
Tsisana will get the opportunity to generate her own income and improve the living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a sewing workshop and earn business income

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, vive con sus hijos de 17, 20, y 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, sola ha luchado para salir adelante con su familia, desde hace 15 años instalo un taller de costura en el que tiene 6 empleados, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, dicha actividad es su fuente de ingresos y no representa dificultades por el momento. 
Comprará telas, hilos, botones, agujas, entre otros materiales para elaborar las prendas de vestir y pagara el personal que tiene en su taller de costura, le será de ayuda para mejorar la productividad del negocio e incentivar a sus empleados para realizar un mejor trabajo.
María sueña con fortalecer su negocio dar una vida más confortable a su familia y cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
María lives with her children, who are ages 17, 20, and 22. She is a single mother who has fought to provide for her family on her own. Fifteen years ago, she set up a sewing shop where she oversees six employees. She works every day with no fixed schedule. This business is her source of income and so far it has not run into any difficulties.  

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, and other sewing materials to make her clothing items, and to pay her sewing shop staff. It will also help her increase her business' productivity and incentivize her employees to do a better job.

María's goal is to strengthen her business so that she can give her family a more comfortable life and pay off her debt with a good credit score.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: To make a living, Marife runs a sari-sari store business in their village. She is 39 years old, luckily married, and blessed with three children. Marife’s husband is employed but she wants to help her husband to fill their needs even in just a simple way. Marife wants to increase her income. That’s why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items such as toothpaste, detergent soap, shampoo, and many more. She hopes to increase her income and save some of it for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as toothpaste, detergent soap, shampoo, and many more.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 55 years old, married and her family lives in Solana. She sells grocery items and vegetables to the people in her village. She wanted to improve her sales and that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy vegetables and grocery items to sell. This will help her income grow. Someday, she hopes to save good funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married father of two children and is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, fifteen years ago he started selling tamarind, jallab (a type of fruit syrup made from carob, dates, grape molasses, and rosewater), and salep (a sweet syrup consisting mainly of milk powder and plant orchid tubers) to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying raw materials necessary to prepare tamarind, jallab, and salep.

Ahmad hopes to open his own shop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials necessary to prepare tamarind, jallab, and salep syrups.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has a motorcycle transport business in Narok town. He used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle, and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle and serve more customers, as well as make more income. He hopes this will help him provide for his family's needs and also expand his business by buying more motorcycles.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business and increase his income.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 56 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Anastacia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anastacia has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers for harvesting maize

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta, a 55-year-old married mother of nine children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a broom-making business in the Philippines for 10 years.

Cristeta has requested a PHP 6000 loan NWTF to buy materials such as bamboo stick and other supplies to use in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo stick and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Aurea has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aurea has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aurea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Shaline

texts.en:
Shaline is married and has four children who attend school. She operates a vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces  stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her area.
 
Shaline requested a loan from Yehu for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Shaline owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom don't attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 17 years and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 32 years old, is married, and has six children.

Eunice likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Eunice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Eunice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate five acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: A young and growing entrepreneur, Yasir, 28, is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Karachi. He recently started selling dairy items like milk at his shop as well. Currently he does not have a deep freezer to keep perishable items due to which he can not store and thus sell such items at his shop. His new business is not stable enough to give him sufficient financing so he has requested a loan to buy dairy items, especially milk, and a deep freezer for his shop. He is hopeful that his business will flourish and is working hard to make it successful.

loans.use: to purchase a deep freezer and milk for his general store.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa vit à Agoè et est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est une femme veuve et habite avec une personne à sa charge. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Yawa vend des produits d’alimentations générales afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Yawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Yawa demande ce prêt pour acheter des tomates et légumes pour alimenter son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en: Yawa lives in Agoè and is 28 years old. She is a widow and resides with one person she supports. To do better supporting her demonstrated needs, Yawa sells grocery items to obtain the revenues for covering day-to-day expenses. She gets her supplies four times a month at the market. Yawa is asking for this loan to purchase some tomatoes and vegetables in order to supply her shelves and thus derive the necessary profit for alleviating her challenges and expanding her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase some vegetables and a box of tomatoes

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Adjo est une femme veuve avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Adjo vit dans le quartier de Daliko. Adjo vend de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoucouthcou préparée à base du mil. Adjo  trouve un revenu pouvant couvrir ses charges mais nécessite réaliser plus de bénéfice. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Adjo sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de mil pour réaliser la préparation de la boisson à ses consommateurs
texts.en: Adjo, aged 48, is a widow with five children to support. She lives in the Daliko district and sells a local drink commonly called Tchoucouthcou, which is made from millet. Adjo seeks income for covering her expenses but also needs to make more profit. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. Adjo is requesting this loan to purchase a sack of millet to make this drink for her consumers.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of millet

loans.name: Simbi

texts.fr: Simbi est une femme veuve avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Simbi vit à  Filako et est âgée de 48 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Simbi vend des sojas frits dans son quartier trouve un revenu pouvant couvrir ses charges mais nécessite réaliser plus de bénéfice. Pour disposer de son stock, Simbi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Simbi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de soja afin de satisfaire agréablement ses consommateurs.
texts.en: Simbi is a widow and has five children to support. She lives in Filako and is 48 years old. To make a profit, she sells fried tofu in her neighborhood and seeks income for covering her expenses but needs to make a profit. To obtain her inventory, she supplies herself three times a month at the market. Simbi is requesting this loan to purchase a sack of soybeans to satisfy her consumers in an agreeable manner.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of soybeans

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en: Sophan’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Semia

texts.fr: Semia est une femme qui vit à Daliko et est âgée de 45 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Semia vend des chaussures au marché. Semia arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenu. Pour vendre efficacement ses chaussures, Semia achète quatre fois par mois ses articles au grand marché. Semia sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de chaussures.
texts.en: Semia is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Daliko. To make a profit, she sells shoes at the market and manages to meet her family’s day-to-day needs, thanks to this revenue-generating businesses of hers. To sell shoes efficiently, she purchases her goods for times a month at the big market. Semia is requesting this loan to purchase boxes of footwear.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of shoes

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El socio Humberto se sigue dedicando al negocio de imprenta, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su famiia, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de imprenta. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tarjetas y folletos.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Humberto, is still making a living from his printing business. The member is a hardworking person that through this business brings forth his family.

The member's dream is to extend the printing business. 

The member is requesting a loan to purhcase cards and brochures.

The partner is happy for the loan and promises to meet his quota payments.

loans.use: the member is requesting a loan to purchase cards and brochures

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza casas y edificios, el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es tener un negocio propio como una tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como madera,pintura y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still devoted to the business of construction. He makes houses and buildings. Through this job he can move his family forward. The member's dream is having his own business such as opening a small grocery store. 

The member is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials such as wood, paint and tools. The partner is happy for the loan and promises to meet his quota payments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as wood, paint, and tools.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with three children of 21, 17, and 2 years respectively. She has rental houses, a business she has done for six years now. She earns a monthly income of KES 38,000.

Teresia has requested her sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000, which she will be using to purchase materials for construction, as well as pay wages for the workers. She successfully repaid her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Teresia will be able to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to see that her children are educated for life, as she continues to expand her rentals.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction as well as pay wages for the workers.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita, a 52-year-old married mother of four, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 17 years now. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, and is now requesting a PHP 6000 loan to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

In the future, Edita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers for harvesting maize.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Gladys has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, Gladys wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Enovejes

texts.en:
Enovejes, a 51-year-old mother of seven children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines.
