Enovejes has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell at her food stall. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
A villager from a rural district of Kampong Cham province, Neang, whose age is 37, is married, with two children. 

Neang and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava to support their family for almost 20 years. On average, the couple could earn around USD 20 a day. For many years, the farming business was not good because the price of the crop dropped. 

Neang is an old client of VisionFund Cambodia. After fully repaying her first loan, she requested another loan from VisionFund Cambodia to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. With this loan, Neang hopes to grow healthy crops and, hence, make more profit, so that she can fulfill her dream of having a new and bigger house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 56-year-old, proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Josephine has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Josephine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Josephine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is 55 years old and married, from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of three sons. Najwa and her family work in their agricultural land in the village, where they plant seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Najwa also has her own business as a wedding planner.  She uses candles and other handmade decorations.

Najwa took a USD loan from FATEN. The loan will help her to buy raw materials like candles and fabrics for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 

Najwa appears in the photo with some of her work

loans.use: to buy raw materials like candles and fabrics for her business as a wedding planner

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es: Pedro de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado vacuno, posee 22 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, la comercialización de sus productos la realiza en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra sacar a delante a u familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y el alquiler de la parcela ya que no tiene terreno propio para cultivar y asi poder seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He makes a living cultivating basic grains and raising cattle, and has worked in this activity for 22 years. The marketing of his products is done in the surrounding towns and he has already established clients. What he gets from sales helps him to raise his family. He asks for this loan to buy agricultural inputs and to rent a plot. He does not have his own land to cultivate so he wants to continue with his work and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and rent a plot.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace un año, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, café, leche, huevos , pan dulce, azúcar, entre otras cosas todo por mayor y asi poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman's face has been blurred because she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk environment.

She has had a small store, located inside her house, for a year. She has many customers, especially neighbours. She lives in her own house with her husband and her son.

She is requesting a loan to buy canned soups, basic grains, coffee, milk, eggs, pastries and sugar among other products, all in bulk. This way she will be able to make more profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned soups, basic grains, coffee, milk, eggs, pastries and sugar among other products, all in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36 years old and married to a cellphone technician. She has owned and managed a direct-selling business for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 a month. Her net income on this business usually goes to their savings. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase clothes, shoes, and bags to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, and bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and better corn and bean seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Jeanebeth

texts.en:
Jeanebeth is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeanebeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jeanebeth has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, condiments, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, condiments, noodles, pancit, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, condiments, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio Jaime sigue trabajando como maestro de construccion, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de su trabajo saca adelante a su familia, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro para que pueda trasladar sus herramientas. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cemento,pinturas y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jaime continues to work as a master of construction, he is a hardworking person who provides for his family through his work. His dream is to buy a car so that he can move his tools. He is asking for the loan to buy cement, paints and tools. Jaime is happy to have the loan and is committed to completing his scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, paints and tools.

loans.name: Edwin Mansur

texts.es: Edwin de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre, el se dedica al transporte de personal todos los días, tiene 10 años de dedicarse de experiencia en el rubro, con lo que obtiene en su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con los gastos de su casa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y colocando piso cerámico en la sala y cielo falso, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cerámica, cemento, arena, hierro, cielo falso y pago de mano de obra para tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Edwin is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his father. He works in transporting people every day. He has 10 years work experience in this field and with what he makes from his work he manages to get ahead with the household expenses. He wants to make improvements on his house cementing over the floor and laying ceramic tiles in the living room and a dropped ceiling. What he makes from his work will not cover the expense so for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy ceramic tile, cement, sand, re-bar and pay for labor to have a better quality of living and a dignified house.

loans.use: to by ceramic tile, cement.sand, re-bar, a dropped ceiling and pay for labor.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар, 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Чынар среднее образование, на протяжении 12 лет она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Чынар в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы и 15 овец, также на земельном наделе 0,9 ГА собственной земли, она выращивает фасоль. Чынар очень честная и трудолюбивая. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynar is 46 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. Chynar has a secondary education and has been involved in fattening up livestock and farming for 12 years. Today Chynar has 2 cows and 15 sheep on her farm, and also 0.9 hectares of her own land, where she grows beans. Chynar is very honest and hardworking. To further develop her business, Chynar requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a heifer. She plans to use the earnings from the loan on developing her farm and also on repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Namnien Group

texts.en:
Thongma understands the difference that a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Local water sources require boiling before drinking, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter that Thongma purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and  the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Thongma is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years. She and her group can continue to receive the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sobhia Group

texts.en:
Boun is excited that a water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  She and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filters that Boun and her group decided to buy are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years.  Boun and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Boun and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Paktheuk Group

texts.en:
Khanti’s village gets much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Khanti and her group are excited that a water filter is available on a payment plan that made its affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khanti and her village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water can have on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users like Khanti’s family expect a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида 27 летняя молодая девушка. Она не замужем, живет с бабушкой и братиком в городке Курган-Тюбе. Саида получила хорошие знания и образование. 5 лет она работала по профессии. Она хорошо и вкусно  печет лепешки. Этому Саида научилась у своей подруги. В будущем Саида мечтает стать хорошим пекарем. Во всем ей помогают родные и близкие. Но по состоянию здоровья она не может работать в данный момент. Для этого ей требуется значительная сумма средств. Поэтому она просит вас дать ей кредит, для восстановления здоровья. Премного вам благодарна за помощь.
texts.en: Saida is a 27-year-old young woman. She is not married and lives with her grandmother and brother in the town of Qurgan-Tube. Saida obtained good knowledge and education. She worked in her profession for 5 years. She can bake delicious flatbread well and learned this trade from her friend. Saida dreams of becoming a good baker in the future. Her relatives and friends help her with everything, but at the present time she is unable to work due to her health. She needs a significant amount of money to recover. This is why she is requesting this loan to help her recover. She is very grateful to you for the help.

loans.use: to recover her health

loans.name: Thana Group

texts.en:
Kongmee understands the difference a water filter makes for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Kongmee purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money otherwise spent on charcoal or time needed to forage for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is even available.    

Kongmee is excited that the filter was purchased with an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years. This way, she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзада, 35 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Нурзады среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Нурзады есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка, лошадь и 5 овец, также земельный надел, мерою 1,50 ГА, где она ежегодно сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры, картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Вся экологически чистая продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит прибыль в размере до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей и нетели. Доходы от кредита Нурзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет накопить средства на покупку дома для сына.
texts.en: Nurzada is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Nurzada has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in agriculture since 2000, when she started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Nurzada's farm contains 2 cows, 2 calves, a horse and 5 sheep, and also 1.50 hectares of land, where she annually plants agricultural crops, potatoes and corn for sale. All of her ecologically clean products are in high demand and yield a profit of up to 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Nurzada requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy horses and a heifer. Nurzada plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and also wants to save money to buy a house for her son in the future.

loans.use: to buy horses and a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una venta de productos varios (zapatos, ropa, mochilas, peluches, etc.) tiene 6 años de tener su negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal, vende todo el año y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para surtir su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes y ella tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. She owns a stall of various products (shoes, clothes, backpacks, soft toys etc.) She has had this business, which is situated in the municipal market, for six years, sells all year round and has many customers. She lives in her own house with her three children. She is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale to stock her business and thus better meet her customers' needs and have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more products wholesale (shoes, clothes, backpacks, soft toys etc.)

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 33 years old, married and has a child who is 10 years old and is in the fourth class at secondary school. Vugar lives with his wife and child in the Fuzuli region but he has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Füzuli city for over 23 years.

Vugar has been raising cows for 6 years. He buys little calves, raises them and sells then in the local bazaar. Today Vugar wants to buy calves for his farm. For this reason he need 1300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). Therefore he has applied to Komak company for a loan. He says thank you to Kiva for the help.

In the future he wishes to develop the industry, increase his income and give his child a good education.

loans.use: to buy calves, so, in the future, he can increase and develop his business, increase his income and give his child a good education.

loans.name: Sitoramo

texts.ru: Ситорамо 48 лет. Она живет с двумя детьми в районе Бохтар, так как ее муж работает в России. У Ситорамо высшее образование. Она работает телеведущим специалистом на протяжении 10 лет. Она очень умная и хорошая мать. Стремиться понять людей. Помогает своим работникам. Дети часто советуются с мамой. Для улучшения жилищных условий она хочет сделать ремонт у себя дома. Чтоб в доме было уютно и тепло. Но у нее не достаточно средств. Поэтому она простит вас дать ей значительную сумму. Заранее выражает свою признательность.
texts.en: Sitoramo is 48 years old. She lives with her two children in the Bohtar district because her husband works in Russia. Sitoramo has a college education. She has been working as an anchor specialist for 10 years. She is a very smart and good mother. She strives to understand people and help her employees. The children often seek advice from their mother. She wants to make repairs at home in order to improve her living conditions and ensure that her home is comfortable and warm, but does not have enough money. This is why Sitoramo is asking you to lend her a significant amount. She expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to make repairs at home in order to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan has been operating her grocery store for four years and two months.  She is 38 years of age and still single. She aims  to have a better way of living and have a viable source of income someday.

For now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to be use in buying boxes of chocolates, three boxes of noodles, five boxes of canned goods, and ten boxes of sachet vinegar and soy sauce for her grocery store.

She believes that through this loan, she could increase her income, improve her living condition, and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chocolates, three boxes of noodles, five boxes of canned goods, and ten boxes of sachet vinegar and soy sauce for her store

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is 42 years old and married.

Jelma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jelma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is 51 years old and married with six children, two of whom are under her support.

The family has been growing corn for around thirty years and this is their only, and main, source of income. With the hope of growing good quality corn and selling it for higher a profit, Nary has formed a group which consists of three members to request their first loan from VisionFund. As a leader, Nary will spend her loan portion on fertilizers, corn seeds and labor fees for land plowing.

Nary wishes to get enough household equipment for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and also to pay labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nahshon's Group

texts.en:
Nahshon, pictured above, has been a farmer for 12 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 45 years old, married and has seven children.

Nahshon likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Nahshon plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Nahshon’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate nine acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Ketrai's Group

texts.en:
Ketrai, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than twenty years, and is now proud to represent her group of eleven farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 47 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Ketrai likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Ketrai plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Ketrai’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru: Шамсия проживает в районе Шахритус. В свои 42 года она жена и мать двоих детей. Она помогает всем своим родным и близким, всегда протягивает руку помощи. Шамсия трудолюбивая, чистоплотная хозяйка.  Она выдала своему сыну невесту. Они оба счастливы благодаря маме. Шамсия занимается животноводством. Шамсия продвигает работу своих родителей. Сама она занимается над этим уже 5 лет. Животные всегда чистые и сытые. Она обожает свою работу. Шамсия хочет увеличить поголовье скота, но для этого ей необходима значительная сумма денег. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Shamsiya lives in the Shahrituz district. At 42 years old, she is a wife and mother of two children. She helps all of her relatives and friends and always extends a helping hand. Shamsiya is a hardworking and thorough homemaker. She found a bride for her son, and both of them are now happy, thanks to the mother. Shamsiya is involved in animal husbandry. She continues the work of her parents and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her livestock is always clean and fed. She adores her work. Shamsiya wants to increase her livestock headcount, but needs a significant amount of money for this. She requested a loan for this reason. She expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, и у нее 3 детей. Старший сын на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он часто отправляет им деньги. Мехринисо заботливая мама. Она хозяйственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Мехринисо в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ежегодно Мехринисо сажает урожай. 10 лет упорного труда и она достигла своих больших высот в этой сфере. В данный момент она хочет расширить свои земли, но для этого ей необходимо небольшое количество средств для приобретения минеральных удобрений. С такой просьбой она обратилась за кредитом. В надежде на то, что Вы ей поможете достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Mehriniso lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. Her oldest son works in the Russian Federation. He often sends them money. Mehriniso is a caring mother. She is a good homemaker and a hardworking woman. Mehriniso is involved in agriculture in her district. She annually plants crops. After 10 years of hard work, she achieved high peaks in this business area. At the present time, she wants to expand her land, but needs a small amount of money to buy mineral fertilizers. She requested a loan for this purpose. She hopes that You will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to expand her business

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 45-year-old married mother of four children who has been running her own clothes-selling business since 2009. She has sixteen years of experience in this domain.

Rana is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections, especially to satisfy her customers' needs for the upcoming Mother's Day, as she wants to help her son in paying his house's debenture.

Rana hopes to expand her business more in the future and to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections, as she wants to help her son in paying his house's debenture.

loans.name: Aslan Group

texts.en:
Diaa is the featured borrower for Aslan Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Diaa is a 45-year-old single lady who has worked in a company for eleven years to cover her expenses and needs. Due to the increasing living conditions, Diaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling girls' accessories which will help increase her income and improve her living conditions. Diaa is the lady standing in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Maha is the first lady on the right, and Reem is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling girls' accessories

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de jocote y granos básicos (maíz y frijol), casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad por esa razón tiene mucha experiencia y cosecha buenos cultivos, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Carlos está solicitando un crédito  para la compra de insumos agrícolas para darle un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos y poder recoger buenas cosecha para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their four children in a house that they own.  He works growing jocotes and basic grains (corn and beans).  He was worked as a farmer for most of his life and he has a lot of experience.  He harvests good crops and is able to sell them around the region where he lives.

Carlos is seeking a loan to purchase farming supplies in order to care for his crops and be able to harvest good products to increase his earnings.

loans.use: purchase agriculture supplies to care for his crops.

loans.name: Cesar Ronald

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la extracción de arena para la venta, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la agricultura el cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos de enero a mayo en los pueblos aledaños, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y el alquiler de parcela, ya que el no cuenta con terreno propia para la siembra, y con ese préstamo podrá seguir con su abajo para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The young man's face is pixelated because of his age (27 years old) and the fact that he lives in a dangerous area.  He works growing basic grains and extracting sand to sell.  He has four years of experience in farming, having started with his own financed.  He sells his produce from January to May in surrounding towns.  He lives with his wife and their three children in a house that they own.

He is seeking a loan to purchase farming supplies and to pay the rent on a plot of land since he does not have his own land to farm on.  This loan will allow him to continue with his work so that he can provide greater financial stability to his family.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies and pay for the rent of his land.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo, 55, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost thirty years. 

Currently, Sambo would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Liwanag

texts.en:
Liwanag, aged 35, is married to a motorcycle driver. She has owned and managed a food vending business in their village for almost six years. In this business she sells daily cooked meals, and some grocery items for additional income. With this she earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She's hoping that her business will continue to give her success so that she can support their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. Peter runs a retail business where he sells household items like milk, bread, sugar, and washing detergents.

Peter has requested a loan of KES 60,500 from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to add household items like milk, bread, sugar, and washing detergents. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With anticipated profits, Peter  will be able to expand his business further. His hope and dream for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to add household items like milk, bread, sugar, and washing detergents

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He also sells motorcycle accessories. 

Duncan has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle accessories. 

Duncan's business goal is to buy another motorcycle within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable and will excel in business.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 42 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joanna is 22 years old now.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Joanna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Joanna has been in this business for one year. In the future, Joanna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lanie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lanie has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 44 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, shampoo, condiments, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, coffee, diapers, oil, soy sauce, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, shampoo, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Yerevan town where she lives with her two sons. 

She works at a local sweet production factory. Besides her work, on weekends, she also makes dough and sells it to local candy and sweet shops for the production of cookies and other pastries. 

Lusine works hard to cover orders from her customers and drive her small but profitable business to its next stage of development. 

Lusine needs this loan to purchase materials and tools which will help her to continue her production business. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for making dough for cookies and pastries production

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a 29-year-old married woman from the Kareli district. She has a husband and three children. The family gets income from her husband's activity, who works as a private artisan and gets approximately 250 GEL. As the existing income is not enough for a five-member family and Eliza can’t find a job, she decided to start her own business. All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Eliza applied for credit at MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of their Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the received credit, Eliza will start making fruit cookies and start selling them locally for good prices. It will give her a chance to generate her own income and become financially independent. Eliza and her poor family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to start making fruit cookies to sell locally.

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en:
Tamazi, who is a 51-year-old married man, lives in Kutaisi city, west Georgia. He has only a wife, who works as a cleaner and gets a small salary. Her salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So, Tamazi decided to start his private activity and requested a loan. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1000 for purchasing all the needed tools and to start working as an artisan. He will get the orders and will renovate houses and commercial spaces.  

The new business initiative will give Tamaz the chance to have financial stability and monthly income. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools and to start working as an artisan

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
Gladness is a married mother of 5 children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years, Gladness has been operating her poultry business, selling to her neighbors.

With the loan she is requesting Gladness will purchase chicken feed and chicks to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks to resell.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Naomi, the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three children. Naomi has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Naomi isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Naomi will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Naomi's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en: Un is 49 years old and is a mother of three children, one of whom is under school age. Raising pigs is the main source of income for the family. To get additional money, Un and her husband also make wine for selling in the village. With the hope to generate more profit to expand her current business of pig raising, Un, after fully repaying her previous loan, has formed a new group which consists of two members to apply for another loan from VisionFund. Un will use her loan portion to get more piglets for raising and later sell them for profit when they grow big enough.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Ernest's Group

texts.en:
Ernest is a 65-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of ten farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Ernest has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Ernest described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Ernest’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Tbaung Khmum district's Kampong Cham province, Sambath, aged 45, is married with six children. Two of her children are under the family's support while the rest can feed themselves by working as garment workers and electricians. 

Corn farming is the only and main source of income for Sambath's family which she and her husband have been doing for around twenty five years. Having financial difficulty in maintaining the business, Sambath has formed a group of two members to request their first loan from VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion on fertilizers as well as corn seeds with the hope to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: El Lanchon Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Lanchón, está conformado por 14 mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras (ADELMA, BRENDA FELICITA, CELIA, ELNA, ESTELINA ESTELA, FLORA, GERALDINA LEONOR, GLORIA, IVANIA, KELA ROSANA, MARJORIE, MARY, MARY LEE y MERCIA), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, todas viven en la comunidad de Wawa Boom, conocida por el río Wawa. Hay que cruzar el característico Lanchón, que es como un ferry de hierro que cruza los vehículos de un extremo a otro del caudaloso río, para conectar los municipios de Puerto Cabezas y Waspam, con el Triángulo Minero, en el Caribe Norte. En este ferry al lado izquierdo las integrantes del banco comunal han colocado mesas de madera con sombrías para protegerse del sol y la lluvia, con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y ofrecer sus productos de venta de frito, tamuga, gaseosas, refrescos, venta de queque de yuca, banano.

MARY LEE: Es la coordinadora del banco comunal, tiene 37 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos: Tres adolescentes que estudian su primaria en la escuela de comunidad de Wawa Boom y un pequeño de un año de edad. Con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar, desde hace 3 años se dedica a venta de fritos a la población que cruza el rio Wawa, por medio del Lanchón. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, gaseosa, filipitas, sal, aceite, vinagre, repollo, tomate, pollo, pescado y yuca, para elaborar fritos y tamuga. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa y tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
El Lanchón communal bank consists of 14 determined and hard-working women (ADELMA, BRENDA FELICITA, CELIA, ELNA, ESTELINA ESTELA, FLORA, GERALDINA LEONOR, GLORIA, IVANIA, KELA ROSANA, MARJORIE, MARY, MARY LEE, and MERCIA), who belong to the Miskita ethnic group.

All the members live in the Wawa Boom community, known for the Wawa River. To go from the municipalities of Puerto Cabezas and Waspam to the Mining Triangle, in the North Caribbean, people take the Lanchón—an iron-made ferry that transports vehicles across the fast-flowing river.

With the aim of having their own source of income, the members of the communal bank sell their products on the ferry. They have placed wooden tables with parasols—for sun and rain protection—on the left side of the ferry, where they sell "fritos" (deep-fried snacks), "tamuga" (a type of Nicaraguan tamale), soft drinks, beverages, cassava cakes, and banana cakes.

MARY LEE is the coordinator of the communal bank. She is 37 years old, is married, and has four children: three teenagers, who go to the elementary school in the Wawa Boom community, and a one-year-old child. For the purpose of providing for her family, she has been selling "fritos" to the people crossing the Wawa River on the Lanchón for the past three years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy snacks, sodas, "filipitas" (a variety of banana), salt, oil, vinegar, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, fish, and cassava in order to make "fritos" and "tamuga."
 
Her dream is to be a successful merchant and have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, "filipitas," salt, oil, vinegar, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, fish, and cassava to make "fritos" and "tamuga."

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. 

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 31 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a motorcycle spare parts business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and start a transport business and hopes the income generated will help him open another spare parts shop. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and start a transport business to help him open another spare parts shop.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary, 38, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business. Theary primarily grows rice and sesame and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for seventeen years. On average, she is able to make an earning of 5 USD a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Theary is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for repairs and maintenance on the truck she uses to transport her merchandise.

loans.name: Hesborne's Group

texts.en:
Hesborne's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Hesborne, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married, and has two children. Hesborne has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Hesborne isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Hesborne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Hesborne's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jalia's Group

texts.en:
Jalia is a 32-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jalia has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jalia described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jalia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 50-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual. He is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Patrick has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Patrick described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light along with fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 16 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has four children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition she also operates a poultry farming business which earns her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to add her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
A residing living in Battambang province, Sophat is 25 years old and a mother of one child. For her living, she grows rice and corn as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via growing sesame. 

For Sophat, this is her third time with VisonFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Voeut

texts.en:
Voeut, 40, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. He has three children, two of whom are in school and other one is too young. 

Nowadays, he can earn income to support his family via growing rice, corn, and sesame. This is his third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loans successfully. 

He will spend his entire loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer to support his farm. He hopes that he can earn more income to update his living better than before.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer to support his farm.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah est âgée de 27 ans et vit à Légbassito. Mariée, elle a un enfant à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari dans leur épanouissement. Amah vend des produits d’alimentations générales devant son domicile afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Amah s’appovisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour acheter des cartons de tomates, Amah demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit
texts.en:
Amah is 27 and lives in Légbassito. Married, she  is raising one child and she works hard to help her husband assure their well-being. Amah sells general foodstuffs in front of her home in order to make a good profit. She buys her wares four times a month at the market in Lomé. 

To buy some cartons of  tomatoes, Amah is requesting this loan so she can meet her objective and earn a profit.

loans.use: to buy one carton of tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora engages in a business making native baskets to earn a living. She is a 48-year-old married mother of two grown children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in basket weaving for more than 10 years . Her husband is a carpenter. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like nito (palm), bamboo and wicker (material or products consisting of plaited or woven twigs). These materials will be used in making baskets, and she will deliver them to her local community. She will be able to increase her income and settle her obligations. She would be able to set aside some savings for emergency use and afford better living conditions.

Flora hopes that she will be able to handle her current source of income properly to improve the family's livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito (palm), bamboo and wicker (material or products consisting of plaited or woven twigs )

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Battambang province, Kam is 39 years old. She overcomes her family’s hardships by growing corn on a half-hectare area, and earns additional income growing sesame. 

Her previous loans repaid, Kam has requested her third one from Kiva partner VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to buy seed and fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get greater yields and earn more income to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Fatima Rosaura

texts.es:
Fátima, es casada, vive con su esposo y una hija, su negocio consiste en vender frutas y verduras en un puesto del mercado municipal, lo atiende de ocho de la mañana a tres de la tarde lo hace junto a su esposo, de esa manera genera los ingresos con los que puede dar lo necesario a su familia para salir adelante.
El capital que necesita lo utilizara para comprar papayas, melones, papas, pepinos, etc., surtirá el negocio con mercadería fresca para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, realizara esta inversión esperando tener mejores ventas e ingresos que serán el respaldo para el pago de su deuda.
Los sueños que Fátima tiene son mantener el negocio en el mercado, seguir luchando para salir adelante con su familia y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Fátima is married. She lives with her husband and their daughter.

She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables at a stall in the municipal market. She, together with her husband, works there from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. In this way, she generates the income to provide her family with everything they need to get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy papayas, melons, potatoes, cucumbers, and the like. She will stock up her market stall with fresh produce in order to meet her customers' needs. She will make this investment hoping to improve her sales and income, an income that will secure the repayment of the loan.

Fátima's dreams are to continue with her business at the market, to keep on striving to get ahead with her family, and to provide a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: to stock up her business with fresh produce such as papayas, melons, potatoes, cucumbers, and the like to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Bilal Group

texts.en:
Rabeha is the featured borrower for Bilal Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rabeha is a 47-year-old, married mother of two children, who has been making handicrafts for five years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved kids. She is working hard to develop her business. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy raw materials in order to prepare special crafts for the upcoming Mother's Day. 

Rabeha is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Rima is the lady standing in the middle, and Samira is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in order to prepare special crafts for the upcoming Mother's Day.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf Khan, 44, is married and the father of five children. He belongs to Karachi. He sells ice creams, milk and mobile credit and easy load in the shop. He is hardworking and polite. He has managed to develop a good network of clients and has managed a good number of regular customers. His income is mostly consumed in fulfilling his daily family expenses. 

As the population in the nearby area is increasing, the demand for ice creams and milk has also increased. Therefore, he wants to buy these items to gain more customers and to increase his revenue, but due to financial constraints he has requested a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. He is thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk and ice cream in bulk quantity for his shop.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 36 years old, married, and has eight children.

Daniel likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Daniel plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Daniel’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Choeuy

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Choeuy is 59 years old and a mother of one child. To support her family condition, she grows rice on a two-hectares area. She has been involved this business for ages. 

This is Choeuy’s third cycles with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her family condition, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing her farm.

loans.name: Narom's Group

texts.en: Narom’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Atilio Antonio

texts.es: Don Atilio vive en casa propia con su esposo, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y con lo que obtienen de sus pagos logra salir adelante, el quiere ampliar mas su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para la cocina en la parte de atrás de su casa, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder hacerlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de laminas, arena, cemento, ladrillos, polines, puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Atilio lives in his own home with his wife.  He works as an employee in a private company and with what he earns he has succeeded in moving forward.  He wishes to make his house bigger by building a room for the kitchen at the back of the house, but with what he earns he can't manage to be able to do that.  

For this reason he is asking for a loan through Integral to buy sheet metal, sand, cement, bricks, poles, doors, iron bars and to pay for labour.  In this way he will be able to have a better quality of life and a decent home.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, sand, cement, bricks, poles, doors, iron bars and to pay for labour

loans.name: Dúo Marchando Con Cristo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Marchando con Cristo
Doña Consuelo es originaria de Tecpán, ella tiene 59 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad esta  su hijo, ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de consumo diario y también a la elaboración de tejidos a mano.
El esposo de ella trabaja como carpintero y gracias al apoyo de el y al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en surtir mas su tienda y comprar mas materia prima para sus tejidos. 
Ella sueña con ampliar más su tienda, surtirlo con más variedad de productos, ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a su hijo a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario para vender.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo is originally from Tecpán and is a part of the group Dúo Marchando con Cirsto. She is 59 years old and under her responsibility is her son. She has a small shop where she sells items for daily consumption, and she also does weaving by hand.

Her husband works as a carpenter and thanks to his support and the support of her children she has been able to succeed with her business. The loan that she received she invested to stock her store and to buy more raw materials for her weavings. 

Her dream is to expand her store and stock it with a larger variety of products, so that she will have better earnings and send her son to school for a better future.

She is requesting this loan to purchase products for daily consumption to sell.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell for daily consumption.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en: Hoy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hoy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cheak's Group

texts.en: Cheak’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Cheak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en: Long’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Long makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom, 29 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing and selling rice to the local dealer and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years.  On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

For additional income, she wants to buy a cashew plantation to operate a farming process. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, to afford the plantation. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cashew plantation.

loans.name: Lo's Group

texts.en: Lo’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lo makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en: Ouk’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ouk makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en: Sarum’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Sarum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Oscar Napoleon

texts.es: Oscar de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cuenta con mas de 22 años de experiencia en esa actividad, vende sus productos a los comerciantes de la zona donde el reside, y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de su producto, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. para poder tener mejores cosechas y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Oscar, aged 62, lives in his own home with his three sons.

He makes a living growing corn. He has over 22 years of experience in this field. He sells his products to the merchants from the area where he lives, and he has many customers because of the quality of his product. Thanks to the sales he makes, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, inorganic and organic fertilizers, and the like to be able to have a better harvest and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inorganic and organic fertilizers, and the like.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos, cuenta con equipo de pesca y negocio propio, se dedica desde hace 2 años a ese rubro con el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica, puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener junto con su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Ricardo is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He makes a living selling seafood along with fishing equipment and has his own business. He has been engaged for 2 years in this category with which he has achieved success with his family. He wants to improve their housing, finishing with constructing their home. But with what he gets from his job he cannot afford his goal. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase cement, sand, ceramics, doors, balconies and payment of labor and be able to live in a decent home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, ceramics, doors, balconies and payment of labor.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Wilson, who is the group leader, pictured above. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Wilson has been a farmer for 16 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Wilson isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Wilson will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Wilson's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: Channa’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Channa makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Re's Group

texts.en: Re’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Re makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el cliente se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, posee 10 años de experiencia agrícola y empezó con capital propio, vende sus cosechas en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene lora salir adelante con sus gastos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, productos agroquímicos entre otros y así poder obtener una mayor producción en sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose, age 35, lives with his life partner in his own house.  He grows corn and beans.  He has ten years of experience in agriculture.  He started with his own capital.  He sells his harvests at the different markets that are close to his house.  With the earnings that he gets he manages to get ahead with his expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, agrochemical products, and others.  This way he will be able to get greater production of his crops in order to get better financial earnings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, agrochemical products, and others.

loans.name: Annsylivia

texts.en:
Annsylivia is married, with two children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells umbrellas, boots, bags, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area, and her primary customers are daily. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of umbrellas, boots, bags, and other items. 

She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of umbrellas, boots, bags, and other items to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 49 years old and married.

Felicitas is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicitas has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felicitas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley and her group member live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as a seamstress to support her family.

In the two women’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. The group is applying for a 576,000 KHR loan through iDE, part of which will be used to buy a water filter. Having a filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married and has four school-going children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Patricia has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking to neighbors. In addition she operates a business selling bricks.

She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy more materials for making bricks for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to  purchase more materials for making bricks for resale

loans.name: Thalung Group

texts.en:
Dai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Dai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.

Dai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Dai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Oysanam

texts.ru: Ойсанам 46 лет. Она жительница района Шахритус. Ойсанам мать 5 детей. Она заботливая мать не смотря на то, что у нее нет образования она смогла вырастить и поставить их на ноги. Как и во многих семьях, сыновья Ойсанам работают в Российской Федерации. Они помогают маме. В работе она уже 4 года. Она сажает  помидоры и арбузы. Для купли семян помидора, арбуза, и минеральных удобрений ей необходим кредит. Поэтому она обращается к вам в надежде на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Oysanam is 46 years old. She lives in the Shahrituz region, and is the mother of five children. She is a caring mother and despite the fact that she didn't have an education, she was able to raise her children and set them on their feet. As in many families, Oysanam's sons are working in the Russian Federation. They help their mother. She has been doing this work for four years already. She plants tomatoes and watermelon.
