She needs a loan to buy the tomato and watermelon seeds, and fertilizers. For this reason she came to us and hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy tomato and watermelon seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nongbuakham Group

texts.en:
Maithone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After adding up the costs, Maithone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter would have for them and their families. The cost of ten TerraClear filters is 3,550,000 LAK. The water filters are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. Maithone is especially excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven  quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, también trabaja como jornal, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con sus padres y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc. para la producción de 4 mz. de maíz y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He grows corn, but he also works as a day laborer. The borrower sells his products at the markets near his house, where he lives with his parents.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and other supplies for the four plots of corn he has planted. As a result, he can continue his sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, pay for labour and buy certified corn and bean seeds

loans.name: Laokha Group

texts.en:
Lea understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filters Lea and her group bought with 8,330,000 LAK from TerraClear Development will increase the group’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and reducing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Lea is excited that the filters were purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for two years. She and her group can expect to receive the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to buy a water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y a la crianza de ganando, tiene 18 años de experiencia y por esa razón cosecha buenos cultivos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancia que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de 7 Mz. de plátanos y así poder tener una buena cosecha para  tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis is 40 years old and lives in his own home along with his mother. He cultivates bananas and raises livestock. Luis has 18 years of experience, which explains why is able to produce good crops. He sells his products at different markets that are located near his home. With the income he earns, Luis is able to cover some of his household expenses.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies so that he can maintain seven plots of bananas. This will help him achieve a good harvest and have more income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies so that he can maintain seven plots of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for his store and to buy a griddle to make pupusas

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de condimentos,la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio sac adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los condimentos.La socia solicita  el credito para comprar condimentos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her business of selling condiments. Through her small business, she is able to help her family get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell condiments. She is requesting a loan in order to buy condiments.

The borrower is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy condiments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven  a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuanta con 5 años de experiencia cultivando granos básicos, se dedica a esta actividad de invierno y vende su cosecha en agro-servicios que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de 3 años, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder aumentar su producción para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young borrower's face is blurred, because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She works cultivating corn and beans, and has 5 years of experience in this activity.  She farms in the winter and then sells her harvest to the agro-services companies that are located near her home.  

This young woman lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 year-old daughter.  She is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs, such as: organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc.  This way, she can increase her production and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Diedo

texts.en:
Diedo earns a living by engaging in a tuba (coconut) wine vending business. He is a resident in the town of Loon, Bohol. He is 53 years old, and is a married man with two children, ages 20 and 17 years old.

He has been engaged in a tuba vending business for more than 10 years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy additional gallons and tungog (it gives tuba its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation). 

With these materials, Diedo will be able to produce more tuba (coconut) wine. In this way, he will be able to cater to the needs of his customers. Then he could now pay his obligations and provide a nutritious diet to the whole family.

He is hoping that he would be able to expand his current sources of income to become successful and sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons and tungog (it gives tuba its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. He is married with six children. He has had a business selling tea leaves for 15 years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase more tea leaves for sell to make more income; he hopes this will help him educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve his business and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more tea leaves and get more income

loans.name: Sergio Andres

texts.es:
Gorras, sombreros, bermudas, medias, ropa interior camisas, bolsos, accesorios, productos de uso personal en general mercancía muy variada es la que ofrece Sergio un joven con un futuro prometedor, a sus 19 años de edad consolido de este negocio recogiendo ahorros con mercancía que vendía ambulantemente y ahora que tiene su negocio su mayor reto es mantenerlo y  hacerlo cada vez más grande y con más mercancía.
Sergio en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gorras, carcasas y estuches para celular, ponchos y sombreros, el pide tu ayuda es joven y necesita apoyo, de momento se encuentra estudiando para administrar mejor su negocio y en un futuro expandirse a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Caps, hats, Bermuda shorts, socks, undershirts, bags, accessories, and personal use products are among the various types of merchandise offered by Sergio. This young man has a promising future. At the age of 19, he established this business by consolidating his savings from the merchandise he sold as a street vendor. Now his greatest challenge is to maintain his business and make it larger by adding more merchandise.

At the moment, Sergio is requesting a loan in order to buy caps, phone covers and cases, ponchos, and hats. He is asking for help because he is young and in need of support. Sergio is currently studying how to manage his business better so that he can expand into other cities in the future.

loans.use: to buy caps, phone covers and cases, ponchos, and hats.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 60-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mohamed has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Mohamed described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours so his children will be able to study. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Mohamed’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Imelda has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods. 

Imelda is committed to rebuild her business, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy item to sell in her general store like shampoo, soap, and other groceries

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en:
Huch is married with four children, one of whom is still in school and under her support. Huch and her husband have been growing corn for more than 20 years in their village, in Tbaung Khmum's Kampong Cham province. 

With financial difficulty in her business, Huch has formed a group which consists of four members to request their first loan from VisionFund. Huch will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer as well as for farmland plowing. 

With this first loan, Huch really hopes to grow good quality corn so that she can sell it for a higher profit and ultimately she can get sufficient household equipment for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phonsaon Group

texts.en:
Souy’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Souy and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Souy and her village also understands the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Souy’s family, identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dong Group

texts.en:
Viengphet understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Viengphet knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Viengphet purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  
  
Viengphet is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Houv's Group

texts.en:
Houv’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Houv makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thong's Group

texts.en:
Thong’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Thong makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jack's Group

texts.en:
Jack is 29 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Jack is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Jack's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing two solar lights as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Jack and his group will receive a total of 19 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 9.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 44, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily growing rice and cassava, and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for 25 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.50 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.  

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Narin’s Group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Musa, who has been a farmer for more than 20 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Musa has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Musa started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs, but also two solar lights as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Musa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 18 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the repayment expenses and maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional weaving.

loans.name: Santos Leandro

texts.es: Santos de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermano, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol, posee 10 años como agricultor, cultiva en la época lluviosa y saca sus productos en los meses de diciembre a enero y los comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, gracias a sus ventas es  como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas así como muestra en la fotografía para tener una buena cosecha y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his brother.  He makes a living farming corn, sorghum, and beans.  He has been a farmer for 10 years, planting during the rainy season and harvesting his crops in the months of December and January and selling them in the area around where he lives.  His sales activities allow him to cover some of his household expenses.    

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides (such as those seen in the photo) in order to have a good harvest and therefore a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang, a farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 29 years old and a mother of one schoolchild. For her living, she earns income via rice cropping on two-and-a-half hectares of area. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. Hang will spend her entire loan portion on buying fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides to support her farming. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides to support her farming.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
A farmer from Battambang province, Phan is 58 years old and a mother of one child. She can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping on a five hectares area. She has been  involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 33,800 KHR per day. This is fourth cycle for Phan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Julidah's Group

texts.en:
Julidah is 48 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Julidah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 7 farmers in the Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Julidah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Julidah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Eurn's Group

texts.en:
Eurn’s Group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Eurn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en: Thol’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Thol makes a living by cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en: Yoeun’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Yoeun makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la extracción de cal, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 28 años,  con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro  y pago de mano de obra, y así poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Julio is 61 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has made a living extracting lime, and he is able to cover some of the household expenses through his sales activities.  

He wants to improve his home by constructing a room in the location shown in the photo, but he doesn't have enough funds to build it, so he is applying for a loan to buy the necessary materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and iron, and pay for the labor.  Then he can have a dignified home.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and iron, and pay for labor

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 30 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo y así poder tener una buena cosecha y incrementar sus ganancias y darle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their son.  He makes a living farming corn, beans, and sorghum.  He has been farming for 30 years, and he sells his crops in the area around where he lives.  His sales actives allow him to cover some of the household expenses.  

He is applying for a loan to buy agricultural inputs for the cultivation of corn, beans, and sorghum so that he can have a good harvest and increase his profits, providing a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for the cultivation of corn, beans, and sorghum

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, sus hijos le ayudan en el trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los mese de diciembre a febrero y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener un mejor cultivo para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alfredo is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his 4 children. He works growing corn and sorghum and has more than 20 years experience. His children help him with the work. He sells his product in the months of December through to February and has many clients. With what he makes from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and thus be able to have a better harvest for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 6 meses, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young man has had his face blurred out because he is 23 years old and living in a high-risk area.  He owns a store located in the area where he has been living for the past 2 years.  He has a lot of customers because he provides a good variety of products at good prices.  He lives in his own home with his wife and 6-month-old son.  

He is applying for a loan to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other products, and therefore bring in a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other products

loans.name: Dúo Las Orquídeas Group

texts.es:
Dúo las Orquídeas
La señora RICARDA  de 24 años, casada,  desde hace 3 años posee tortillería, ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña RICARDA es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más maíz para poder seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Orquídeas" (The Orchids) duo.

Señora Ricarda is 24 years old and is married. For three years she has had a tortilla stand located in Chimaltenango, which she managed to set up based on her efforts. With her business, she has improved her house and maintained and raised her family.

Doña Ricarda's dream is to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family through the micro-loan that she is requesting from FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy more corn to be able to continue growing with her business.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas to sell

loans.name: Jorge Vinicio

texts.es: Vinicio es un joven soltero de 25 años de edad, vive con su madre en una casa por la que paga arriendo, Vinicio se dedica  a trabajar en una mecánica y también se dedica al comercio de papas los fines de semana, Vinicio necesita el crédito para  comprar papas, ya que comenta que le va bien en este negocio,  la aspiración de Vinicio es de mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias que le queden seguir apoyando a su madre ya que ella trabaja de empleada domestica y sus ingresos son bajos.
texts.en:
Vinicio is a young, single, 25-year-old man who lives with his mother in a rented home.  He makes a living working in a mechanic's shop and also sells potatoes on the weekends.  

Vincio needs a loan to buy potatoes, and he notes that he is well suited for this business.  His aspirations are to improve his business and use the leftover profits to continue supporting his mother since she works as a housekeeper and has a low income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed concentrate

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries and corn.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria agradece el crédito brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con COMIXMUL ya que gracias al mismo compro los insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, comprando al mismo tiempo semilla de maíz y frijol de primera calidad la cual sembró y cultivo logrando obtener 35 quintales de maíz y 20 de frijol vendiendo estos a muy buen precio en el mercado local. Ella está muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona y por el apoyo financiero brindado ya que gracias al mismo ella logro salir adelante en la temporada y despreocuparse de muchos compromisos. Ella solicita en esta nueva ocasión un nuevo crédito con el cual elaborara el mismo proceso la compra de semilla de maíz y frijol certificada y los diferentes insumos que son utilizados para prevenir plagas y perdidas ya que tiene un pedazo de tierra al cual quiere dar el uso adecuado y generar más ingresos económicos que ayuden al desarrollo de su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is grateful for the loan offered by the Kiva investors in alliance with COMIXMUL, since thanks to this she bought the agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizers, and at the same time she bought first quality seeds for corn and beans, which she planted and cultivated, managing to obtain 35 quintals (about 3500 lbs) of corn and 20 quintals (about 2000 lbs) of beans, selling these at a very good price in the local market. She is very grateful for the confidence placed in her and for the financial support offered, since thanks to this she managed to get ahead in the season and stop worrying about many obligations. 

She is applying on this new occasion for a new loan with which she will go through the same process, the purchase of certified seeds for corn and beans and the various supplies that are used to prevent plagues and losses, since she has a parcel of land to which she wants to give appropriate use and generate more economic income that will help in the development of her family and her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and seeds for corn and beans to plant again

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat (pictured) is 32 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2004 and has two sons. They are still young.

Nat is a farmer with 10 years experience, while her husband has been a construction worker for 10 years. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to take to work. Presently her husband goes to work by bicycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to take to work.

loans.name: Juan Alpidio

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 29 años de edad, padre de un pequeño hijo de 7 vive junto con su pareja y procura ser feliz, es dueño de un cultivo de flores producto de flores.
La situación de Juan se tornó complicada cuando por razones que no quiere mencionar perdió la mayoría de su cultivo dejando sin algo en que invertir para la próxima etapa y más sabiendo que apenas acaba de iniciar año.
Juan solicita muy formalmente un apoyo de un monto superior la razón es que por las considerables pérdidas tiene su negocio en cifras rojas, con tu apoyo puede comprar los insumos que necesita para seguir con su negocio de cultivo de flores, comprar la gallinaza, los abonos, riegos, pesticidas, los insecticidas, pago de jornales, en pocas palabras tu apoyo simbolizara el renacer de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is a man of 29, the father of a little son of 7 years. He lives with his partner and tries to be happy. He is the owner of a planting of flowers.

Juan's  situation became complicated when, for reasons that he doesn't want to mention, he lost the majority of his crop.  This left him without anything for the next season and, worse yet, the year had just begun.

Juan is very formally applying for support in a higher amount. The reason is that because of the considerable losses, his business is in the red. With your support, he can buy the supplies that he needs to continue with his business of raising flowers, that is,  buy poultry manure, compost, irrigation, pesticides, and insecticides, and pay for day laborers. In a few words, your support symbolizes the rebirth of his business.

loans.use: to reactivate his business by buying supplies and paying day laborers

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mon makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es: A sus 56 años de edad Elisa es madre soltera pero su hijo e hija ya son independientes ya que tiene 25 y 28 años, Elisa se dedica  a la venta de ropa y también  trabaja de profesora en una escuela situada en el campo y muy alejada de la ciudad, Elisa es una señora muy trabajadora ya que saco adelante a sus hijos, Elisa vive con su hija de 28 años de edad, Elisa desea el dinero del crédito para comprar mercadería en ropa, que la vende a sus amigas o clientas, la aspiración de Elisa es de que por medio de su negocio le permita apoyar en lo que mas pueda a su hijo para que termine sus  estudios.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Elisa is a single mother, but her son and daughter are now independent at the ages of 25 and 28. Elisa earns a living selling clothes and also works as a teacher at a school located in the country, very distant from the city. Elisa is a hardworking woman and has already gotten her children ahead.

Elisa lives with her 28 year-old daughter. She is requesting the loan to buy an inventory of clothing that she sells to her friends or clients. Elisa's dream is that through her business she will be able to support her son in every way possible so that he finishes his schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Solidario Sagrado Corazón De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Solidario Sagrado Corazón De Santo Tomas
Este solidario está integrado por doña Carmen Carolina, ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de zapatos para dama, caballero y niños en general desde ya hace varios años, así como venta de cosméticos, ropa de bebe y objetos de librería en su negocio ubicado frente al parque de su comunidad, vende de lunes a domingo ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de ropa para bebe, su mayor deseo es encontrar un local más grande ya que el que actualmente tiene ya le queda pequeño para su mercadería y le cuesta mucho movilisarse.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Sagrado Corazon de Santo Tomas" (Sacred Heart of St. Thomas) includes Doña Carmen Carolina. She is 44 years old, and she has been selling shoes for women, men, and children in general for a number of years. She also sells cosmetics, clothing for babies, and stationery items in her business, which is located across from the park in her community. She sells from Monday to Sunday.

She is applying for a loan to invest in clothing for babies. Her great desire is to find a bigger shop, since the one she has now is already small for her merchandise, and it's very difficult for her to move around.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana es una señora de 50 años de edad, su esposo falleció hace 10 años atrás, Mariana trabaja de conserje en una escuela, y también se dedica a  la crianza de animales menores, Mariana vive con 2 hijas y 2 nietas, en esta ocasión el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, para criarlos en cuyeras que tiene en la casa donde vive, lo que Mariana aspira de este negocio es comprar más cuyes y así mejorarlo para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana is a woman of 50. Her husband died 10 years ago. Mariana works as a custodian in a school, and she also raises small animals. Mariana lives with two daughters and two granddaughters. At this time, she is going to invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs, to raise them in pens that she has at her house. 

What Mariana aspires to in this business is to buy more guinea pigs and thus improve the business in order to get ahead, along with her family.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna is 40 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Genna works very hard to provide for her family.

Genna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs and other groceries.

Genna has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of goods, such as soap powder, coffee, biscuits, canned goods, candies, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Genna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Phceun's Group

texts.en:
Phceun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phceun makes a living cultivating rice and she does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en:

Narim makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the group's members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter that will provide safe drinking water for his family.

texts.en:
The members of Ravai’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ravai makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help all the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es: Don José, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a su madre y hermano, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Don José toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia, ha cultivado maíz y frijoles y café, siendo el café lo que más le ha dado ingresos. Ofrece el café en grano en el mercado de la zona. El ha obtenido varios préstamos para mantener en buen estado su parcela de finca de café. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar más abonos e insumos para fertilizar y darle asistencia a su finca de café. Su objetivo es cultivar más café y obtener buena cosecha.
texts.en: Don José is 52 years old. He is single, and lives with his mother and brother. He lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. Don Jose has dedicated all of his life to agriculture, along with his family. He grows corn, beans, and coffee, being coffee what has given him the most earnings. He offers coffee beans at the market of the zone. He has received several loans to keep his coffee farm in good shape, and he is currently asking for another loan of 20,000 Lempiras to buy more fertilizers and inputs to fertilize and care for his coffee farm. His goal is to grow more coffee and to obtain a good crop.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and inputs to fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Dúo Emanuel De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Emanuel de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña María Mercedes, ella tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica al alquiler de computadoras (cafe internet)y venta de memorias USB, discos, adaptadores, su negocio esta ubicado en el frente al parque de su comunidad tiene dos años de tener su negocio, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de accesorios de computadoras en su negocio de café-Internet, su mayor  deseo es seguir comprando más computadoras y poder darles un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Emanuel de Santo Tomas duo includes Doña Maria Mercedes. She is 32 years old, and her work is renting computers (internet cafe) and selling USB memories, disks, and adaptors. Her business is located across from the park in her community. She has had this business for two years. She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of computer accessories for her internet cafe business. 

Her great desire is to continue buying more computers and be able to give better service to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Manuel Migdonio

texts.es: Manuel, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro.  Desde pequeño se ha dedicado al comercio, tiene varios años de vender naranjas y plátanos o bananos. Las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante en la comunidad y sus alrededores. Ha obtenido dos préstamos anteriores con la institución para tener capital de trabajo, actualmente solicita otro por 5,000 lempiras para comprar producto de naranjas y plátanos para vender. Su plan es continuar con el negocio, tener siempre capital para comprar y vender producto y ayudar a su esposa con lo que necesite.
texts.en: Manuel, 22 years old, lives in a common law marriage with his partner and resides in the town of Morazan, Yoro. He has worked in business since he was little, and has sold oranges and plantains or bananas for several years. He carries out his sales on the streets of his community and surrounding areas. He has obtained two previous loans with the institution to have working capital. He is currently requesting another for 5,000 lempiras to buy oranges and plantains to sell. His plan is to continue with the business, to always have capital to buy and sell product, and to help his wife with what she needs.

loans.use: to buy oranges and plantains to sell.

loans.name: Mavlakat

texts.ru: Это женщина Мавлакат. Ей 56 лет. В свои годы она добилась многого. Она мать четверых детей. Супруг на заработках в Российской Федерации. Старший сын служит в армии. Мавлакат получила среднее образование. У них в семье у каждого есть своя работа. Сама Мавлакат занимается выращиванием скота. Она любит домашних животных. Мавлакат хорошо ухаживает о животных. Она берет кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота, потому что с помощью животноводство Мавлакт зарабатывает на жизнь. Этот кредит  поможет ей расширить животноводство. С такой просьбой она обращается к вам. Мавлакат надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Meet Mavlakat, a 56-year-old woman who has achieved a lot in her life.  She is the mother of four children.  Her husband is currently working in Russia.  Her oldest son is serving in the army.  Mavlakat has a secondary education.  Everybody in her family has their own job.  Mavlakat herself raises livestock.  She loves domestic animals and takes good care of them.  Since animal husbandry is her only source of income, she is taking a loan to increase her livestock headcount. This loan will help her to expand her animal husbandry business.  She is turning to you with this request and is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en: Net’s group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Net makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru:
Озода ответственная и терпеливая женщина. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж предоставляет услуги по ремонту домов. Озода с мужем растет троих сыновей. 
   Озода дома занимается шитьем одежды и на дому принимает заказы, таким образом, она помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Озода 5 лет занята этой деятельностью. Она решила купить новую швейную машинку. Новая машинка улучшить качество работы и ускорить процесс. Она давно копила деньги на новую машинку, но к сожалению накопленных денег не хватает на покупку и Озода обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Ozoda is a responsible and patient woman.  She is 37 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband.  Ozoda's husband makes a living renovating houses.  Ozoda herself works from home, sewing clothes.  Thanks to her activity, she helps her husband provide for the family.  She has been involved in this activity for the past five years.

Ozoda has now decided to buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to improve the quality and the speed of her work.  She has been saving money for a long time already, but unfortunately her savings are still not enough to make this kind of purchase.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Solidario Mariposas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Solidario Mariposas de San Bartolo
Este solidario está formado por doña Julia Felisa ella tiene 42 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de refacciones en la Escuela de su comunidad, y tambien se dedica a la venta de consumo diario en su tienda Llamada Adonaí, vende azúcar, pan, leche, golosinas, gaseosas, aceite, jabón , pastas etc.,posee su negocio desde hace muchos años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de aguas gaseosas, golosinas y la otra parte para la inversión de su negocio de refacción, como carnes, pasteles, papas, aguas, cereales, frutas gelatinas su mayor deseo es tener éxito en esta inversión.c
texts.en:
Solidario Mariposas de San Bartolo [Butterflies of San Bartolo Solidarity Group]

Julia Felisa is part of this solidarity group. She is 42 years old and makes a living selling snacks in her community's school. She also sells everyday products in her store called Adonaí. She sells sugar, bread, milk, cookies, soda, oil, soap, pasta, etc. She has had this business for many years.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of sparkling water and cookies, and another portion to invest in her snack business, buying meat, pastries, potatoes, water, cereal, fruit, and Jello. Her greatest desire is to be successful in this investment.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Soeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soeurn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and electronics repairer to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Wendy Yessenia

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector de la comunidad de Cofradía, Cortes. Hace 3 años que Wendy inicio con su propio negocio de venta de comidas y golosinas en una cafetería de una escuela de la comunidad y vende refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas, tajadas con carne, pastelitos, baleadas, jugos, agua etc. Ha obtenido varios prestamos en la institución, actualmente solicita otro prestamo por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar refrescos, churros, agua, galletas y otros materiales para la elaboración de comidas rápidas. Su meta es mantener el negocio surtido para incrementar las ventas y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wendy is 30 years old, and lives in a civil union with her partner, with whom she has 3 children. She lives in a section of the community of Cofradía, Cortes.

Three years ago, Wendy started her own business selling food and sweets in a community school's cafeteria. She sells soda, churros, sweets, cookies, meat slices, tarts, baleadas [savory stuffed tortillas], juice, water, etc.

She has received several loans from the institution. She is currently requesting another loan of 8,000 lempiras to buy soda, churros, water, cookies, and other supplies to make fast food.

Her goal is to keep the business stocked in order to increase her sales and provide schooling to her children.

loans.use: to purchase soda, churros, water, cookies, and other supplies to make fast food to sell

loans.name: Oy's Group

loans.name: Seyyad

texts.en:
Seyyad is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. His son studies at the second course of college, and his daughter goes to the eleventh class. Seyyad’s wife is a housewife and helps Seyyad on his business. 

His family is an IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) family from Füzuli city. It is already 22 years now that they are living in the Füzuli region. 

Seyyad has cows. He sells their milk and milky products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) that are made by Seyyad and his wife. 

Now Seyyad wants to repair the stall of the cows. Therefore, he needs  a loan amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Seyyad is thankful for the help from the Kiva organization and lenders. In the future, he wants to help his children's education.

loans.use: to repair the stall of the cows

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, 37, is single and lives in Jarash. Salma is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman. She opened a business which sews women's clothing and coats from the individual orders that she receives. 

She has applied for a loan in order to improve her shop and to buy more sewing machines and fabrics so that that she can sew a greater variety of clothes. 

This loan will allow her to purchase more fabrics and attract a larger number of customers. Please help Salma to meet her goals, she needs your support.

loans.use: to improve her shop and buy more sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
"Moses is a 38 year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Moses has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Moses described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Moses’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
"James is a 35 year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, James has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

James described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, James’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his shop and buy tools to increase the quality of his products

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman living together with her husband and two children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gul Nasreen

texts.en:
Gul nasreen is a 49 year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past ten years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Gul nasreen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these products. Therefore, Gul nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these commodities and also helpl for him to earn better profits and to manage his household and business. 
Gul nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase items for her husband's general store

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en:
Mark, pictured above, is the group leader and is representing his group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Mark will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Mark plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

All together, Mark’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Janat Bibi

texts.en:
Janat bibi is a 57 year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Her husband has been running a clothing business for 12 years. Her husband is fully responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothing in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Janat bibi is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn a better profit with the help of this loan. 
Janat bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to secure funds for her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is engaged in the furniture making business. She produces cabinets, chairs  and dining table. She is 37 year old with four children. She is a married woman residing in Maribojoc , Bohol. Her oldest child is 14 and the youngest is 2. She has been engaged in the furniture making business for more than 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy materials like wood, varnish (lacquer) and nails. These materials will be of great help for her so she can fulfill the orders from her respective customers.  These purchases will allow her to improve her income and provide her family with nutritious food.  She will be able to handle her finances and start to settle her obligations.

In the future, Antonietta is determined to properly manage her business to make is successful and sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, varnish (lacquer) and nails for her business

loans.name: Nellyanne's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Nellyanne, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 52 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has 4 children.

Nellyanne is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Nellyanne says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Nellyanne will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita offers cosmetic and personal hygiene products within her village.She is 43 years of age, married and has two children, who are attending school.She started her business in 2008. She is also engaged in a transportation and farming business. Angelita has focused herself on a direct selling business.For now, she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP7,000 to be use in buying stocks of cosmetic and personal hygiene products to sell.She hopes and prays that through her requested loan, she can improve her direct selling business and be able to have a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy  stocks of cosmetic products and some personal hygiene products to sell

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is from Vanadzor town. He owns two tractors and with the help of these he provides rental harvesting and cultivating work in the villages near Vanadzor town. 

To be able to bring the tractors into working condition, all Yurik needs is two big and two small new tires. Hence he has applied for this loan. This is important for him to prepare the tractors for the coming new cultivation season. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

Yurik works hard and hopes to be able to support his family in his home country.

loans.use: to pay for two big and two small tires for the tractor to provide harvesting work

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala is 28 years old. She has been married over five years and has a child. They are living in Fuzuli region, but the family members are IDPs from Fuzuli city. Her mother-in-law helps her to educate and take care of her child and Kamala works in the store. This store was opened by Kamala and her husband. Today Kamala wants to support the family business and for that reason, she needs a loan of 1900 (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount, Kamala wants to buy more goods (slippers, brooms, soap, etc.) to sell so she can develop her business and increase her monthly income. Kamala wishes the best for her child and she works hard. Kamala says, “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for support. I’m greatly thankful to you.” In the future, she want to increase and repair the area of the store.

loans.use: to buy more goods and increase her business. In the future, she want to increase and repair the area of the store.

loans.name: Willy's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Willy who has been a farmer for more than 20 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Willy has always been described as a very experienced farmer, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Willy started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also two solar lights as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Willy’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan and will also receive a total of 17 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh has a service business shipping goods. He is 29 years old and he is married with no children. He lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Dinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dinh has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Dinh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet for his home.

With his business profit, Dinh hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet for his home.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a 50-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Rehema has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rehema described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rehema’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Riaz Bibi

texts.en:
Riaz Bibi is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Riaz Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Riaz Bibi's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Riaz Bibi also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Riaz Bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Lauro

texts.en: Lauro is a 44-year-old married man and a father of four children from Dulag, Leyte. He has been engaged in a scrap buying business for more than six years now. He buys and sells recyclable materials like tin cans, galvanized iron, iron bars, soft drink bottles and other items. Lauro is asking to take a loan to buy more scrap materials. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Lauro hopes to make his business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Dulag, Leyte. Helen has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. Helen is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. A loan will help Helen and her husband improve their catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Helen hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Dúo Dios Salvador Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios Salvador
Este dúo está integrado por Mayda ella es originaria de la aldea el arado, ella se dedica a vender carne de res y pollo así como también a la crianza de animales, ella es madre de familia ella necesita un crédito para poder incrementar sus venta y así mismo pagar colegiaturas de sus hijos, promete cancelar puntualmente las cuotas, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Carne de Rez para vender.
texts.en: Dúo Dios Salvador - this duo is made up of Mayda who is from the neighborhood of El Arado.  She sells beef and chicken meat as well as raising animals.  She's the head of the family and they need a loan to increase her sales and help pay her children's tuition fees.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She's requesting the loan to buy beef.

loans.use: To buy beef.

loans.name: Shehnaz Bibi

texts.en:
Shehnaz Bibi is a 56-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a laborer by profession and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Shehnaz Bibi has been running her own knitting business for the past eight years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of knitting items but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Shehnaz Bibi has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
With this financial assistance, Shehnaz Bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her knitting business

loans.name: Dúo El Guite Group

texts.es:
Dúo EL Guite
Este dúo lo forma doña Ana Leticia originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. Ana Leticia se dedica a la tortillería es una persona responsable para hacer sus pagos. Y lucha por mantener a sus familia. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar más materiales(maiz para la elaboracion de tortillas)  y así surtir aun más su negocios para así vender más y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Dúo EL Guite - this duo is made by Ana Leticia who lives in the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. Ana Leticia sells tortillas, is very responsbile with her payments and fights to maintain her family.  
She's requesting a credit to buy more materials  (corn for making the tortillas) and thus be able to better stock her business and be able to sell more and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy corn for her tortilla making business.

loans.name: Grandes Emprendedores Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “GRANDES EMPRENDEDORES” una de ellas es la Sra. Angelica   de 45 años casada   y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Angelica  se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de comida en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Angelica  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Angelica   trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería(MENESTRAS,VERDURAS, CARNES ETC)y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Angelica  se le distingue con una blusa color rosa , se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank "GRANDES EMPRENDEDORES" consists of 5 people who run different businesses. One of them is Angelica who is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Angelica has been selling food every day in a small premises for three years now and this helps her get by and be able to pay her children's school.

With the results of her efforts, Angelica has managed to improve her house and support her children's education. She wants to continue improving her business and her greatest wish is that her children become professionals, this is why Angelica works so hard. She will invest the loan in buying more merchandise (mixed vegetables, greens, meat etc.) to be able to achieve more income.

Angelica can be seen in the photo in a pink blouse; she sends Kiva and Edaprospo a big hug and thanks them for giving her the loan that makes it possible for her to progress.

loans.use: to buy mixed vegetables, greens and meat

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo is a challenged woman. She was born in 1992. She is living in a remote district. She is single and she is a sewer. She was trained on the basics of business planning. She wants to buy new equipment and a sewing machine and enlarge types of dresses to serve women. She is experienced in this sphere of business. She is confident of her plans and hopes her business will develop for further activities. She hopes Kiva members will be merciful.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and a sewing machine

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very simple, adorable woman who is working hard to improve the standard of living for her family.

Her husband could not cover all the needs of her children, especially after her son suffered an injury in his hands that forced doctors to cut off his fingers. So she decided to help her husband with the expenses and the treatment for her son, which are increasing day after day. She started her own business selling clothes and blankets from her home. 

Because she is a very ambitious woman, Amneh wants to develop her work and expand it. Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her buy more products to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: To help her buy more products to sell and increase her income

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer casada muy aterrizada en sus cosas, sabe muy bien que quiere, para donde va y como lograrlo, ella trabaja en un restaurante, ella es la cocina y quien atiende a sus clientes.
Blanca es una mujer casada y junto a su esposo tiene un hijo adolecente que termina de conformar su familia, trabaja diariamente sirviendo platos típicos Antioqueños como frijoles, sudados, sancochos, mondongo entre otros.
Fue gracias a su hermano quien monto el restaurante él le enseño a cocinar, y a cómo administrar un restaurante y hasta el momento aunque empezó con poco  va por buen camino.
Blanca en el momento se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero con el fin de comprar activos fijos para mejorar su negocio, su idea es ir remodelando poco a poco hasta tener un negocio del agrado de sus clientes.
2 mesas, 8 sillas, 1 estufa de 5 puestos y materia prima es el destino de su solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Blanca is a married woman who has her feet on the ground, she knows what she wants, where she's going and how to get there. She works in a restaurant, she does the cooking and serves the customers. She and her husband have a teenage son who has made their family complete. She works every day serving typical dishes from Antioquia such as beans, fish stew, sancocho soup, tripe and others.

It was thanks to her brother that the restaurant was set up. He taught her to cook and how to run a restaurant and up until now, although she began with little, it is working well. Blanca is asking for financial support in order to buy fixed assets to improve her business. Her idea is to redesign it progressively until she has a business that her customers appreciate. Her loan will be used for the purchase of 2 tables, 8 chairs, 1 stove with 5 rings and raw materials.

loans.use: to buy 2 tables, 8 chairs and 1 stove with 5 rings

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es: Jose tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del Municipio de  Gracias, Lempira junto a sus hijos y esposa.  Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura con sus padres. El cuenta con su propio cultivo de café como su fuente  de ingresos.  La producción la vende en pergamino húmedo y seco.  José esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos para fertilizar y pago de trabajadores que le ayudan a darle asistencia a su finca de café. Su meta es mejorar la producción  y los ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 24, is married and has a son.  He lives in a village of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with his family.  Every since he was very young he has worked in agriculture with his parents.  He has his own coffee plantation which is his source of income, and sells both moist and dry produce.

Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL to buy manures and hire workers to fertilize his coffee plantation.  His goal is to improve production and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy manures and hire workers to fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nelson Norvey

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre de 28 años de edad, solitario sin hijos ni pareja solo su fiel amigo su perro que lo sigue a donde vaya, anteriormente tenía un negocio de cría de ganado porcino el cual dejo pro aventurarse en otra actividad económica que no resulto como pensaba, tiempo después quiere retomar su actividad que iniciara de 0.
