Nazneen is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Nazneen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nazneen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. 

Nazneen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nazneen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their six children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including, grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea

loans.name: Jesus Divino Amor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS DIVINO AMOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia ella es soltera y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de textiles, negocio de venta de artesania negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Jesus Divino Amor”. The bank is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Lidia. She is 34 years old, single, and has two children. Lidia works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Lidia has five years of experience in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other group members engage in businesses such as selling textiles, selling handicrafts, managing a grocery store, and operating a restaurant.

Lidia is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ceramic tiles, cement, sand, and labor for installing a floor.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy es un hombre de 31 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 4 años, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, buen padre, independiente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. su actividad la desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Willy es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos negros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que  están comenzando la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio es la cría y engorde de ganado vacuno para el comercio de leche, carne, etc., él se ocupa de visitar las ferias ganaderas del lugar y buscar terneros para la cría y engorde, al cabo de un tiempo cuando el ganado ya ha crecido lo comercializa de diferentes maneras; vende leche, también carne, cuero y otros. “compro afrecho, alquilo pastizales, también comen totora, trato de alimentarlos de la mejor manera…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una quesería y utilizará los beneficios de su negocio para realizarlo, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de terneros vacunos para criarlos y engordarlos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa en 12 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Willy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, forraje, pago de vacunas, cría y engorde para elaborar queso.
texts.en:
Willy is a 31 year old man who is single and has two children who are  5 and 4 years years old. His business is in the trade of livestock. He is entrepreneurial, a good father, independent, constant, active, responsible and hardworking. He develops his activities in the town of 'Batallas' which is located near Lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where he breeds cattle and sheep. They live off of fishing and plants from the area, such as quinoa, potato flour, beans, potatoes, etc. This area is characterized by the cold climate where the suns rays hit the surface strongly.

Willy has a dark complexion, short black hair, black eyes, short stature, and a thin physique. His maternal language is Aymará which they speak in this location, but he speaks Spanish in general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his children who are starting school. They live in their own house made of adobe with a tin roof and electricity. His business is the breeding and fattening of cattle for the trade of milk, meat, etc. He takes care of the livestock fairs in the area and looks for calves to rear and fatten, after a time when livestock markets have grown in different ways. He sells milk, along with meat, leather, etc. He says, "I buy bran, alkyl grasslands, they also eat cattails, I try to feed them in the best way...". His dream is to have a cheese factory and he will use the profits of his business to do it. He wants to expand his business through buying calves and rearing and fattening them. This is his first sequence of loans with the company in the 12 years that he has been developing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Willy asks for a loan to buy cattle, fodder, and pay for vaccines to breed and fatten them to make cheese.

loans.use: to buy cattle, fodder, and pay for vaccines to breed and fatten them to make cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar  is 49 years old and married. She has 6 children. She is a vigorous lady. 

For the past many years, she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. With the loan, Kausar  expects a boost in her earnings and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Bessy Celina

texts.es:
Bessy, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera y tiene una hija que vive con ella.

Bessy, trabaja vendiendo ropa, lo ha hecho por más de cuatro meses, lo aprendió por motivación de su mamá y una hermana; antes solo trabajaba en los oficios domésticos. 

Bessy, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, la venta de ropa se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para ella, es por eso que al apoyarla en este pequeño negocio, se estará contribuyendo al desarrollo de Bessy como comerciante.

Sus sueños son darle un mejor futuro a su hija y tener su propio local para vender ropa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bessy, age 27, went to school through the sixth grade.  She is single, and she has a daughter who lives with her.

Bessy works selling clothes.  She has been doing this for over four months.  She learned because she was motivated by her mother and a sister.  Before that she only worked doing the household chores.

Bessy needs the money from the loan to buy clothes to sell.  Selling clothes has become her main source of income.  That is why by supporting her in this small business you will be contributing to Bessy’s development as a merchant.

Her dreams are to give her daughter a better future and to have her own place to sell clothes at the market.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana has successfully built her business selling cloth in her community with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She earns enough income to bear her household expenditures.  

She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Rukhsana is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 28 years old and married. She is the mother of 3 children. She is motivated to provide her family with better living conditions.

She has been doing an animal purchase and sell business with her husband.  She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell at the market. 

She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell at the market.

loans.name: Roquia

texts.en:
Roquia is 51 years old and married.  

She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Roquia makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR.  She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

Roquia wishes to utilize part of her revenue to provide a good quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available to her customers.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is married and has four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He operates his own mobile shop, which he has been doing for five years.
 
Najma's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do so.  Najma requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which will enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business. This loan will enable him to an increased income to manage his business and household.

loans.use: to provide her husband with funds to purchase different types of mobile accessories

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es: Gloria de 48 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijo y su sobrina, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace 27 años, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa ya que está muy deteriorado pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por ea razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 48-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her two children and a niece. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 27 years. Thanks to the sales she has made, Gloria has been able to help her family get ahead.

She wants to improve her home by replacing the roof since it is extremely worn. However, she does not earn enough from her sales to cover this project. For this reason, Gloria is requesting a loan in order to buy metal roofing sheets and beams, as well as pay for labor, so that she and her family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for metal roofing sheets, beams, and labor.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 35 años de edad con siete hijos de las edades de entre 2 y 18 años de edad que ayudan en las actividades de sus padres. 

Guadalupe es una mujer que ayuda mucho a su esposo, ella desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración de bordados en trajes típicos, eligió esta actividad ya que cuenta que gracias a esto ha logrado mantener a su familia,  pero ella ahora quiere mejorar sus bordados porque día con día el mundo está más de moda, pero una de las dificultades que tiene Guadalupe es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder hacerlo, es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo que utilizara para comprar hilos de todo tipo y colores.

Guadalupe se considera capaz de pagar el préstamo, ya que sus hijos lo estarían apoyando, el anhelo de Guadalupe es conseguir su préstamo lo mas pronto posible para poder mejorar sus bordados
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the community of Sololá. She is 35 years and has seven children between the ages of 2 and 18. They help with the family activities.

Guadalupe is a woman who provides plenty of help to her husband. For the past four years, she has been producing traditional embroidered dresses. By choosing to pursue this trade, Guadalupe has been able to sustain her family. Now she wants to improve her embroideries because the world is becoming more fashionable with each passing day. However, one of the difficulties she faces is not having sufficient capital to make improvements. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy thread of various types and colors.

Guadalupe considers herself capable of repaying the loan since she is able to support her children. Her wish is to secure this loan as soon as possible so that she can begin improving her embroideries.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread of various types and colors.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de loroco, maíz y maicillo,  la clienta tiene 10 años de experiencia  en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícola como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their three children. She cultivates “loroco” [a vine that produces edible flowers], corn, and sorghum. Maria has 10 years of experience in this business and sells her products in the surrounding neighborhoods near where she lives. She has established customers and the income from her sales helps to cover some of her household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and herbicides in order to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, she can continue cultivating her crops so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and herbicides in order to improve her land.

loans.name: Dúo Huerto Del Edén Group

texts.es:
Dúo Huerto del Edén
Doña Aura Roselia es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 28 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad que necesitan el cuidado de ella, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de Tecpan.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue adelante con su negocio el trabaja como jornalero en una gasolinera y con el sueldo de el ayuda a su esposa.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo en surtir mas su venta de ropa, según la necesidad de sus clientes.
Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de  productos en Ropa ya que asi tendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para vender.
texts.en:
“Huerto del Edén” Group

Doña Aura Roselia is originally from Tecpan. She is 28 years old and responsible for two young children who are in need of her care. Aura Roselia sells clothes at the municipal market in Tecpan. Thanks to the support her husband, she has been able to continue forward with her business. Her husband works as an attendant as a gas station, so the salary he earns has been a help to her.

The loan Aura Roselia is requesting will be used to buy more inventory that she can sell, based on the needs of her customers. She dreams of expanding her business and stocking it with a wider variety of clothes so that she can generate better earnings and send her children to school. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está soltero y tiene tres hijos pero ya no viven con él, actualmente vive con su mamá y una hermana. 

Adalberto, trabaja con ganado bovino desde hace más de ocho años y lo aprendió de su padre, decidió hacerlo para sacar adelante a su familia, en el manejo de los animales le ayuda uno de sus hijos.

Adalberto, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos economicamente para que construyan sus propias casas.
texts.en:
Adalberto, 56, studied up to the ninth grade. He is single and has three children, but they do not live with him. He lives with his mother and one of his sisters.

Adalberto has been raising cattle for more than eight years, something his father taught him. He decided to work with this to support his family. One of his children helps him.

Adalberto needs the loan to buy beef cattle. His dreams are to continue working and help his children economically, so that they can build their own houses.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: Akbar has been running a school in his community for three years. He believes that all children deserve a good education no matter where they are born. It is this motivation that led him to start a school and that keeps him determined to make his school better. Through his hard work, Akbar's school now has over 200 students. He requires a loan of 110,000 PKR for repairs to his school building and classrooms. He wants to be able to give his students a good learning environment that will help them learn and grow.

loans.use: to pay for necessary repairs of his school building and classrooms.

loans.name: Shakeela Bibi

texts.en: Shakeela Bibi is 25 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for a year to meet the needs of the entire family. Shakeela Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of inventory such as sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for the general store, but due to financial constraints, her husband is not able to buy all these products. Therefore, Shakeela Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities to help him increase the family income. Shakeela Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en:
Vazifa is 56 years old. She lives with his husband in the Imisli region. For almost 20 years, she’s been working with livestock, having cows (currently, she has three) and selling milk. Her family’s monthly income includes her pension of 70 AZN /month, her husband’s pension of 65 AZN /month and their income from selling milk to some neighbors.

Today she has a health problem. She needs your financial help to buy expensive medications. She has no one to turn to. Vazifa relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy expensive medications

loans.name: Azimio Kichemchem Group

texts.en:
Devotha, who is in her late 30s, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been a tailor for four years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Devotha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more, and better, sewing equipment. She has paid back her loan successfully. She will use her profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more materials and sewing equipment for her tailoring business. She dreams of having her business grow big.

Devotha will share this loan with her loan group "Azimio Kichemchem" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials and sewing equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is 47 years old, married, and has four children. He is from Imisli and lives in a simple humble house. He works at a construction company where he earns a low income, which is the only source of income for his family.
 
Tofiq's elder daughter was born with a disability and another child contracted the flu. They are both on bed rest. Tofiq wants to make sure that his children recover soon. It is very difficult for him because he has to purchase expensive medications and does not have enough money to do so. He requested a loan, which he will use to purchase expensive medications for his children.

loans.use: to purchase expensive medications

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
Otoniel, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene una tienda y los fines de semana prepara golosinas, para vender en las canchas de futbol cuando hay partidos; tiene dos hijos que aún viven con él y estudian.

Otoniel, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto desde hace más de 10 años y lo aprendió de su padre y decidió hacerlo para obtener ingresos para su familia, en el trabajo con el ganado le ayuda su esposa.

Otoniel, necsita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto, con estó podrá tener más ganado y mayores ganancias.

Sus sueños son que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente.- Además, desea ampliar su ganadería y solo lo logrará con su esfuerzo y el apoyo financiero que se le brinde.
texts.en:
Otoniel, 38, studied up to sixth grade. He is married and his wife works as a housekeeper. She has a store and she prepares sweets on the weekends to sell them in the soccer fields when people are playing. He has two children who live with him and go to school.

Otoniel has worked with grazing cattle for over 10 years. He learnt from his father and then decided to make a living out of it to provide for his family. His wife helps him with the cattle.

Otoniel needs the loan to buy cattle so that he can increase the number of animals and therefore make more profits.

He hopes that his children go on studying and become academically prepared. He also wishes to expand his business but he will only achieve it with his effort and the financial support of others.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Ciantarara

texts.en:
Five years ago, Ciantarara started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Mugwe, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. 

Ciantarara believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will also save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Ciantarara thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Three quarters of Kenyan young people struggle to make their way in this world because of unemployment and inadequate funds. This is true for Susan, who is based in the Kenyenya area of Kenya and is a mother of lovely children.

Susan has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows."

Susan sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8-12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Susan is very ambitious. In the near future she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be patient.

Ann operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business and her primary customers are ladies.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy salon equipment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 33 year old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband in improving their financial condition, so she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect, make a better world for her children and provide them with an education.

Fozia is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Ijaz

texts.en:
Ijaz is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is 55 years old, married and has a daughter. They live in Zegduleti in the economically disadvantaged Gori region. The family earns a living from cultivating a small farm as well as a fruit orchard with peach and appIe trees.

With the help of the loan, Alexandre can do the necessary soil working in the orchard and repair the broken-down parts of the surrounding fence. He will use the loan to expand his activities, too. This means cultivating additional land, buying and putting up a new fence and buying appIe tree seedlings.

loans.use: to work in his orchard and plant more appIe trees in order to have a better harvest.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has children. She is from Siongiroi, Kenya. For the past nine years, Regina has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and some personal business she engages in to earn additional income. Regina has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She passionately loves dairy farming. Villagers have nicknamed her Mrs. Cow. 

Regina sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it is a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This milk production will immediately translate to increased profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan. The extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Regina is very visionary, and she intends to start adding value to her milk business.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en:
Wairimu is a Kiva borrower. She has eight children. She describes herself as being patient and honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, sugar, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Wairimu will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will build her own house. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused and disciplined.

He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes for sale. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials for making boxes.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy materials for making boxes

loans.name: Richo Group

texts.en:
Richo from Chorkor is a group made up of seven members. They are responsible individuals with family care in their heart. They are from Chorkor, Accra. These people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. They work in different fields, and that is how they make enough money to support their families. Selling cooking oil, water melons, phones and credit cards, groceries, laptop chargers, utensils and foodstuff.

Thomas is the featured borrower. He is married, with two children, and he is 31 years old. He buys phones and phone credits and sells them to customers. He works some 12 hours daily, and carries out his at his residence to customers. Thanks to his attention to quality, Thomas was able to retain his customer base and even attract new customers, both regular and occasional. The goal of the loan is to buy more phones and phone credits to sell to customers.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 6700 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone credits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has been engaged in the retail business for ten years. He lives and works in Yerevan with his mother, father, wife and two children.

He distributes and sells food products to some of the local food stores in the town. More specifically, Karen sells coffee which he purchases from a wholesale market and smoked dried meat, that his wife makes. The whole family works hard to make ends meet.

All earnings gathered from the retail business goes towards covering kids’ college expenses, utility expenses, food expenses and other ones necessary to provide the minimum living conditions for the family.

Now, in order to be able to purchase food supplies (coffee and meat) for reselling to partner stores, Karen applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for food supplies (coffee and meat) for reselling to partner stores

loans.name: Jorge Romeo

texts.es:
Jorge, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos y a la venta de perfumes; tiene tres hijos, de los cuales solo dos estudian. 

Jorge, trabaja en una microbús escolar desde hace más de cuatro años, él viaja hasta 5 kilómetros recogiendo niños para llevarlos hasta la escuela y de regreso hasta sus casas.

Jorge, necesita el crédito para comprar llantas para la microbús, porque las que tiene ya están desgastadas y no quiere poner en riesgo la vida de los niños. 

Jorge, sueña con tener una línea de microbúses, que brinde el servicio de transporte a más escuelas y beneficiar a estos niños.
texts.en:
Jorge is 44 years old and has a ninth grade education. He has a partner, who looks after the household chores and works selling perfumes. Jorge has three children, only two of whom are in education.

Jorge has been working as a school bus driver for more than five years. He travels over five kilometres picking up children and taking them to school and back home.

Jorge needs this loan in order to buy tyres for his bus. The tyres that he currently has are in bad condition and he does not want to put the children’s lives at risk.

Jorge dreams of having a bus company providing transport services to more schools and to help more children.

loans.use: to buy tyres for his bus.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 58 years old. She is a married woman who has been operating an animal sales business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

Razia has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Ей 54 года, более 30 лет Майрам занимается полеводством. Она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная, на сегодняшний день смогла развить свою деятельность и на арендованном участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает рис для реализации. Рис Майрам продает на центральном рынке. Ее деятельность приносит прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS). Майрам обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян риса и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Mairam is 54 and married with two children. She has been working in agriculture for more than 30 years. She is very hardworking and responsible and has been able to develop her business to the point where she currently grows rice for sale on 2 hectares of rented land. She sells the rice at the central market. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS.

Mairam has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase rice seed and to work the soil. She intends to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and to cultivate the soil in order to grow organic rice

loans.name: Dado Group

texts.en:
Nawal is the featured borrower for Dado Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and standard of living at the same time.

Nawal is a 53-year-old married mother of two children who has sold cosmetics for ten years to cover the expenses and needs of her family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by increasing her business merchandise with more cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs for the upcoming Mother's Day. Nawal is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Amal is the second lady on the left, Wadad is the second lady on the right, and Nour is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics merchandise to satisfy her customers' needs for the upcoming Mother's Day.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be disciplined.

Josiah operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Josiah will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. His business goal is to open a big shop within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 41 years old and widowed with 3 children.

Naomi has had a poultry farming business for 18 years. She will be using the loan to purchase poultry feed and broilers for rearing. She hopes this will help her expand her poultry business, make more income and allow her to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build more poultry houses and rear more poultry.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and broilers for rearing to help her expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children and he describes himself to be focused and disciplined.

Maurice operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes for sale. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials for making boxes.

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: buy materials for making boxes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old, married to Nelia, and blessed with four children, aged 18, 16, 14, and 10 years old. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 10,000 per month.

Joseph has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell to his customers and also to supply to hotels and dairy shops. He plans to use the gains to buy more dairy cows for more milk production and supply.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more dairy cows and to become a large-scale dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be caring.

Jane operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fish and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish and vegetables

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He describes himself as being focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells carpets, bedding, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

Joseph will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of bedding and carpets. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bedding and carpets.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old and has three children. She lives in an upland village called Ojabet, which is part of the Ndaragwa valley. The only activities for Ojabet residents are poultry and dairy farming. Lucy keeps cattle and poultry on her farm. Her primary income sources are milk, a variety of food crops, and eggs. Lucy’s agribusiness has been profitable for five years. She is very contented with farming, not only as an economic activity, but also as a lifestyle. 

Lucy is requesting a loan, which she will use to start horticulture farming. With this loan, she will buy seedlings and will start selling vegetables and fruits in the market that is in her village, which will result in increased income levels. The additional income will be timely as her children’s education expenses keep increasing. The loan will also help her family to enjoy food security.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 46 years old. She is married with six children, aged between two and 20 years. Four of them go to school. 

Marceline is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 21 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested her maize. With the profits from the business, she plans to pay her children's school fees and make some savings, as well.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 54 года, не замужем, мать 3 детей. У Бурулкан средне-специальное образование. В настоящее время занимается животноводством, по хозяйству помогает старший сын. Бурулкан с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 10 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки телят. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Burulkan is 54 and single with three children. She has a specialist high school education and currently works in animal husbandry with the help of her oldest son. She takes her work very seriously and currently has six cows and 10 sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of 22,000 KGS.

Burulkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase calves. She intends to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase her herd

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of one daughter who goes to nursing training school. She is in her mid 60's and lives with her kid. For 31 years now, she has been supporting her family by selling necklaces, wrist lace and earrings. Mary depends on this business to generate income for her family, so she puts all of her energy into satisfying her customers. She explains that she usually works from 8 am until 6 pm on a daily basis, which allows her to realize good profits each month. 

For the sake of improving her business, Mary, together with other two members, approached ID-Ghana to obtain financial support, a total of 5,600 GHS. The group members will hold each other accountable to repay their portions of the loan. This is her sixth loan request, which she would like to use to buy more necklaces, wrist lace and earrings of different sizes to sell to customers. She dreams of growing her enterprise. As a result of this agenda, Mary will be able to generate an increase in her income, which she will use to pay for school fees, household expenses, and expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, wrist lace and earrings of different sizes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Salkyn

texts.ru: Салкын, 61 год, 2 взрослых детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав бизнес с суммы с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Салкын в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы для откорма и перепродажи. На полученные доходы от кредита Салкын планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, чтобы иметь возможность достроить свой дом.
texts.en:
Salkyn is 61 with two grown children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry for 20 years, a business she started with 30,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows on her farm.

Salkyn has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock, so she can finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening and resale

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 51-year-old married woman from the village of Khabume. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law, who gets a pension from the local government. 

Manana and her husband requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. Their loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is from agribusiness. Manana works hard to earn a living, and is engaged in cattle and cow breeding. As well as this she takes care of a poultry farm and also cultivates the family-owned agricultural land, where she grows nuts and maize.  

Now Manana has requested a Credo loan for a business start-up. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Manana will purchase all the necessary tools and equipment for her husband, who will work as a private artisan. He will renovate houses and commercial spaces and will get his own income.
 
As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family's income will significantly increase. Manana and her husband will be able to create better living conditions for their family.

loans.use: To purchase all the necessary tools for her husband to start up as an artisan and make more business income for the family

loans.name: Ayub

texts.ru: Аюб мужчина 40 лет, женат, отец троих детей. Вот уже на протяжение 20 лет он занимается животноводством. На своем участке земли в 10 гектаров Аюб ухаживает за тремя коровами и десятью барашками. Из молоко, полученного от коров, жена Аюба изготавливает сметану и продает на рынке. Также Аюб занимается земледелием. Он выращивает фрукты и овощи. Весь товар он продает и получает прибыль. Аюб хочет купить двух молодых барашков, но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Аюб надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит ему нужную сумму для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ayub is 40 and married with three children. He has been working in animal husbandry for 20 years and is raising three cows and 10 rams on 10 hectares of his own land. His wife makes sour cream from the cows' milk and sells it at the market. Ayub also works in agriculture; he grows fruit and vegetables and sells them for a profit. 

Ayub wants to buy two young rams, but doesn't have sufficient funds. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for financial support. He hopes that Arvand will respond to his request for support and offer him the necessary sum to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase two rams to expand his number of livestock

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is a vigorous 39-year-old married woman. She has had a business doing machine-embroidery for many years.  She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Mafia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is also a mother of four children. 

Mafia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. This will help her to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand consistently to gain more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 25-year-old, single lady. 

Five years ago, she started working in a mobile phone shop. She has a limited salary to cover her needs and expenses. 

Sara is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying desperately to improve her income, and so she is acquiring a Youth loan to start her own business. This will improve her living conditions and help her build an independent future.

loans.use: to start her own business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with 4 children. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to open another branch within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Tadevos

texts.en:
Tadevos runs a bakery. He established his production some years ago. 

In his bakery, Tadevos produces a large variety of cookies, pastries, and sweets. 

To be able to purchase materials for production, Tadevos needs this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

Tadevos lives with his elderly, retired mother and is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making cookies, pastries, and sweets, selling them to partner stores.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 33 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 13 years old. Four of them go to school. 

Olive is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 12 years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvest the maize on her plantation. 

With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children and to improve her standard of living. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Ahouagbé

texts.fr: Ahouagbé vit à Sagboville et est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est une femme mariée et habite avec ses deux enfants. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Ahouagbé vend de la farine de manioc afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Ahouagbé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ahouagbé demande ce prêt pour acheter des bols de farine pour alimenter son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce
texts.en: Ahouagbé lives in Sagboville. She is 40 years old, married and lives with her two children. In order to be able to meet everyday expenses better, Ahouagbé sells manioc [cassava] flour to earn a revenue. Ahouagbé stocks up twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan in order to buy bowls of flour to restock her stand and earn a revenue necessary to support herself and  develop her business.

loans.use: to buy 25 bowls of flour.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nunca es tarde para empezar, fueron las palabras que Dora pensó cuando decidió abrir una pequeña pulpería, desde la comodidad de su hogar. Negocio que le ha ayudado a sopesar los gastos económicos de su familia, y le ha permitido desarrollarse como persona, porque ahora puede trabajar sin descuidar a sus hijos. 
Dora solicita un crédito para abastecerse de granos básicos y comprar: arroz, aceite, frijoles, pan y a la vez, adquirir más productos de temporada escolar como: cuadernos, lápices, blogs, etc. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá incrementar sus ventas, satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y en consiguiente generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
"It is never too late to start," these were the words that Dora thought of when she decided to open her little convenience store, from the comfort of her own home. 

This business has helped her to cover the household expenses, and it has also allowed her to develop as a person because now she can work without neglecting her children. 

Dora is requesting a loan to stock up on basic grains and buy rice, oil, beans, bread, and also to get more items for the school season such as notebooks, pencils, exercise books, etc.

She will be able to increase her sales, to satisfy her customer's demands, and finally to create a better income.

loans.use: to buy: rice, oil, beans, bread and also to get more items for the school season such as notebooks, pencils, exercise books, etc.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is married and has two children. She is living in the Fuzuli region with her lovely family, her husband and two daughters, who are 17 and 15 years old. The family members are refuges from Fuzuli City, and for over 22 years they have been living as IDP (internally displaced persons). 

Zeynab has been in the poultry business for many years. She raises chickens and sells their eggs and meat. Today, for expanding her poultry farm, she needs a loan in amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). Zeynab is very grateful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future she wants give her children a good education and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: for expand her poultry farm, increasing business and enabling her to give her children a good education in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow in order to boost his earnings from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children and she describes herself as enterprising. 

Julian operates a retail business where she sells television sets, chairs and other items. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of television sets, chairs and other items. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully. Her business goal is to open more branches within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of television sets, chairs and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, drinks, oil, sausages, cheese, etc., to have the inputs needed to make and sell 'pupusas'.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional poultry.

loans.name: Viriginie

texts.en:
Viriginie is 45 years old. She is married with four children ages between 7 and 18 years. They all go to school. 

She sells green bananas with  locally made alcohol. She has been in that business for the past 10 years while her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more green bananas and sorghum (for making alcohol) to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, she aims to earn at least 150,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Zareen

texts.en:
Zareen is 53 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy sewing materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui a les deux mains posées sur le sac de céréale est Sira. 
Sira est une femme de  40 ans, analphabète, mère de 5 enfants non scolarisés âgé de 20 à 5 ans. Elle habite au Mali avec sa famille, son mari est cultivateur.
Son activité consiste à acheter les céréales au moment de la récolte et les revendre pendant l’hivernage quand  les prix sont en augmentation. Elle exerce cette activité  depuis  2 ans. Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter plus  de sacs pour  stockage.  Le prêt sera investi dans l’achat des céréales. Il s’approvisionne sur le marché public et revend sur le marché local. Elle produit un intérêt de 22 000FCFA ; Les intérêts  lui servent à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants (soins médicaux, habillements).Sira rêve d’assurer l’autosuffisance économique  de sa famille par cette activité.
Les 4 personnes supplémentaires sont membres du groupe mais qui n'ont pas pris le prêt cette fois ci, il s'agit de la dame arrêtée juste de la porte à coté du sac, à droit de celle là il y a une dame qui tient son enfant en main, et 3 est écrit sur sa tee.shirt, ensuite la dame arrêtée, qui a son pagne en couleur rouge et celle à sa gauche sur la photo.
texts.en:
The lady who is resting both hands on a sack of cereal is Sira. She is a woman of 40, illiterate, and the mother of five children who are not enrolled in school, aged 20 to 5 years old. She lives in Mali with her family; her husband is a farmer. 

Sira's business consists of buying cereals at the time of harvest and reselling them during the rainy season when the prices are rising. She has been in this business for two years. She has approached RMCR to buy more sacks to stock. The loan will be invested in buying cereals. She buys her goods at the public market and resells them on the local market. She produces a profit of 22,000 FCFA. The profit allows her to cover the needs of her children (healthcare, clothing.) Sire dreams of ensuring the economic self-sufficiency of her family through this business.

There are 4 extra people in the photo who are part of the group but have not taken a loan this time. They are the lady next to the door with the bag, the woman with a child in her arms, the man with a 3 on his tee shirt, and the woman in the red skirt at the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy and stock cereals

loans.name: Willayat

texts.en:
Willayat is a 55-year-old widowed woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Willayat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. In this way, the loan will help her to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the materials that she needs to put another roof on her home.

loans.name: Afat

texts.en:
Afat is 47 years old and is a married woman. Together with her husband, she has been doing agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Unfortunately, now Afat has a serious problem with her health. She cannot take treatment because the medical costs are too expensive. For this reason, she needs a loan from Kiva to pay her medical expenses. Please support her.

loans.use: to pay her medical expenses.

loans.name: Halima

texts.pt:
A senhora Halima e assistente tecnica da saude tem 39 anos de idade mae de 3 filhos todos a estudar vive na casa propria e sustenta tambem sua mae enviando lhe dinheiro.
Diz que com este credito ira legalizar o seu espaco comprar cimento,  areia, pedra para dar inicio a sua  obra. 
O emprestimo anterior aplicou na construcao de sua casa que e tem como sonho fazer mais um filho, adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Desafios que tem e insufienciencia de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassa los faz xitique  e tem  uma conta onde faz depositos como forma de poupar.
texts.en:
Mrs Halima is an assistant healthcare worker who is 39 years old and the mother of 3 children in school. She lives in her own house and also supports her mother by sending her money.

She says that she will use this loan to legalize the land on which she lives and buy cement, sand and stone to start construction work on her house. 
Previous loans were used to build her house and her dream is to have another child and buy a vehicle for personal use.

Her challenge is the high cost of living and to get over these she is part of a savings group and also has an account where she deposits money in order to save.

loans.use: legalize the land on which she lives and buy cement, sand and stone to start construction work on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to improve his small-scale farming by selling milk to his clients.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is 42 years old, and she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Anees needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 52 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. She has been running an animal sales business for many years with the support of her husband. She is keen to provide her family with better living conditions. 

Rani has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business where he sells washing soap, rice, flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

Peter will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He also does poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Conceca

texts.en:
Conceca is 37 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 12 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 16 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and sell it. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds of rice production.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tools for the building.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
La dame assise avec les mains sur le mouton est Karidia.
Karidia vie dans une commune rurale au mali, veuve âgée de 58 ans, analphabète mère de 4 enfants dont 2  scolarisés, âgée de 28 à 12 ans. Elle emprunte de l’argent avec  RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de mouton pour nourrir et revendre plus tard. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché et vent au et à crédit ses animaux au même marché.  Elle rêve l’amélioration de l’éducation des enfants, leur santé et leur nourriture suffisante.  Elle est ambitieuse et motivée pour l’épanouissement de sa famille, raison pour laquelle elle fait   recourt à l’IMF. Avec ce prêt de 150 000FCFA Karidia veut engraisser ses ovins enfin de réaliser des profits importants qui lui permet de  satisfaire  les besoins de sa famille. Elle à 10 ans d’expériences.  L’intérêt produit  lui encourage dans le travail d’embouche. Parfois le problème d’approvisionnement se pose. 
Les deux dames sur la photos sont membres du groupe mais n'ont pas pris le prêt cette fois ci, il s'agit de la dame habille en jaune à droit de l'homme, et la dame habille en t-shirt à gauche de l'homme sur la photo.
texts.en:
The lady who is seated and is resting her hands on a sheep is Karida. 

Karidia lives in a rural community of Mali. She is a widow aged 58, the illiterate mother of four children, of whom two attend school, aged 28 to 12 years old. She is taking a loan from RMCR to buy a lot of sheep to fatten and resell later on. She buys her livestock at the big market and then resells them for cash or credit at the same market. 

Karidia dreams of improving the education of her children as well as their health, and of giving them enough to eat. She is ambitious and motivated for the improved well-being of her family, which is the reason why she has come to the micro-finance institution. 

With her loan of 150,000 F CFA, Karidia wants to fatten her flock so as to make a good profit which will permit her to satisfy the needs of her family. She has 10 years' experience. The profit she brings in encourages her to continue fattening livestock. Sometimes there is a problem with supply. 

The two extra women in the photo are members of the group but have not taken a loan this time. They are the woman in yellow to the right of the man and the woman in the t-shirt to the left of the man in the picture.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten for resale later on

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Félicité est une femme veuve avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Félicité vit à  Gblinkomegan et est âgée de 44 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Félicité vend des charbons de bois à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure un revenu pouvant couvrir ses charges mais nécessite réaliser plus de bénéfice. Pour disposer de son stock, Félicité s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Félicité sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons afin de réaliser plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Félicité is a widow with four dependent children. She lives in Gblinkomegan and is 44 years old.

To make a profit, Félicité sells charcoal from her home. This business provides her with a profit sufficient to cover her expenses, but she needs to generate more profit. To manage her stock, Félicité procures supplies three times a month.

Félicité is requesting this loan to buy charcoal bags so as to make more earnings.

loans.use: to buy seventeen bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
O senhor Albino de  62 anos de idade casado pai de 7 filhos dos quais 3 sao maiores de idade 3 a estudar 1 ainda menor vive na casa propria.
Diz que com este credito ira comprar cimento, areia, pedra, ferro para dar ampliar a sua casa. 
Diz que seu sonho crescer no negocio uma vez que tem barraca na sua casa e adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Principais desafios insufienciencia de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassa los faz xitique  e tem  uma conta onde faz depositos como forma de poupar e que ira levantar mais creditos como forma de alcancar seus objectivos, com os emprestimos anteriores fez uma barraca na sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr Albino is 62 years old, married and the father of 7 children of whom 3 are of age, 3 go to school and 1 is still underage but lives in their own home.

He says that with this loan he will buy cement, sand, stone and iron to expand his house.
He says his dream is to grow his business as he currently has a small stall at his house and also to buy a vehicle for personal use.

His main challenges are the lack of money and high cost of living, which he overcomes by being part of a savings group and by having an account where he deposits money in order to save. He will be requesting further loans as a way to reach his objectives and his previous loans were used to build the stall at his house.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone and iron to expand his house.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two years to thirteen years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He says his biggest business challenge is competition. 

Osman will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sabore

texts.en: Sabore is 40 years old. He is married with 5 children. Sabore has had a farming business and it has been profitable. He grows maize, wheat and potatoes as well. He will be using the loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer and grow more cash crops to sell and hence get more produce. He hopes the income generated will help him buy more farm inputs and expand his farming. His hopes and dreams for the future are to sell more farm produce and have a good farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer and grow more cash crops to sell.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a married man. He has two children, aged two years and ten years. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

Pius will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a Kiva borrower. He has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 21 years. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a busy area. He says his biggest business challenge is inflation. 

Moses will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a paint spraying machine. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a paint spraying machine

loans.name: Lenet

texts.en:
Lenet is a lively and resilient woman. She is from a neighborhood that's very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict, but with work and effort and without complaint, she wants to bring her family ahead. Lenet is a mother of three from Nkubu, a remote town in the central province of Kenya. She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Lenet is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she is involved, poultry farming is closest to her heart. Lenet wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Lenet will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Lenet is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Lenet dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, bread, sweets, juices, water, etc., and strengthen her store to offer new products to her customers.
